class.name: @GDScript
class.description: This contains the list of built-in gdscript functions. Mostly math functions and other utilities. Everything else is expanded by objects.

method.name: sin
method.description: Standard sine function.

method.name: cos
method.description: Standard cosine function.

method.name: tan
method.description: Standard tangent function.

method.name: sinh
method.description: Hyperbolic sine.

method.name: cosh
method.description: Hyperbolic cosine.

method.name: tanh
method.description: Hyperbolic tangent.

method.name: asin
method.description: Arc-sine.

method.name: acos
method.description: Arc-cosine.

method.name: atan
method.description: Arc-tangent.

method.name: atan2
method.description: Arc-tangent that takes a 2D vector as argument, retuns the full -pi to +pi range.

method.name: sqrt
method.description: Square root.

method.name: fmod
method.description: Module (remainder of x/y).

method.name: fposmod
method.description: Module (remainder of x/y) that wraps equally in positive and negative.

method.name: floor
method.description: Floor (rounds down to nearest integer).

method.name: ceil
method.description: Ceiling (rounds up to nearest integer).

method.name: round
method.description: Round to nearest integer.

method.name: abs
method.description: Remove sign (works for integer and float).

method.name: sign
method.description: Return sign (-1 or +1).

method.name: pow
method.description: Power function, x elevate to y.

method.name: log
method.description: Natural logarithm.

method.name: exp
method.description: Exponential logarithm.

method.name: isnan
method.description: Return true if the float is not a number.

method.name: isinf
method.description: Return true if the float is infinite.

method.name: ease
method.description: Easing function, based on exponent. 0 is constant, 1 is linear, 0 to 1 is ease-in, 1+ is ease out. Negative values are in-out/out in.

method.name: decimals
method.description: Return the amount of decimals in the floating point value.

method.name: stepify
method.description: Snap float value to a given step.

method.name: lerp
method.description: Linear interpolates between two values by a normalized value.

method.name: dectime
method.description: Decreases time by a specified amount.

method.name: randomize
method.description: Reset the seed of the random number generator with a new, different one.

method.name: randi
method.description: Random 32 bits value (integer). To obtain a value from 0 to N, you can use remainder, like (for random from 0 to 19): randi() % 20.

method.name: randf
method.description: Random value (0 to 1 float).

method.name: rand_range
method.description: Random range, any floating point value between 'from' and 'to'

method.name: rand_seed
method.description: Random from seed, pass a seed and an array with both number and new seed is returned.

method.name: deg2rad
method.description: Convert from degrees to radians.

method.name: rad2deg
method.description: Convert from radias to degrees.

method.name: linear2db
method.description: Convert from linear energy to decibels (audio).

method.name: db2linear
method.description: Convert from decibels to linear energy (audio).

method.name: max
method.description: Return the maximum of two values.

method.name: min
method.description: Return the minimum of two values.

method.name: clamp
method.description: Clamp both values to a range.

method.name: nearest_po2
method.description: Return the nearest larger power of 2 for an integer.

method.name: weakref
method.description: Return a weak reference to an object.

method.name: funcref
method.description: Returns a reference to the specified function

method.name: convert
method.description: Convert from a type to another in the best way possible. The "type" parameter uses the enum TYPE_* in Global Scope.

method.name: str
method.description: Convert one or more arguments to strings in the best way possible.

method.name: str
method.description: Convert one or more arguments to strings in the best way possible.

method.name: print
method.description: Print one or more arguments to strings in the best way possible to a console line.

method.name: printt
method.description: Print one or more arguments to the console with a tab between each argument.

method.name: printerr
method.description: Print one or more arguments to strings in the best way possible to standard error line.

method.name: printraw
method.description: Print one or more arguments to strings in the best way possible to console. No newline is added at the end.

method.name: var2str
method.description: Converts the value of a variable to a String.

method.name: str2var:var
method.description: Converts the value of a String to a variable.

method.name: range
method.description: Return an array with the given range. Range can be 1 argument N (0 to N-1), two arguments (initial, final-1) or three arguments (initial,final-1,increment).

method.name: load
method.description: Load a resource from the filesystem, pass a valid path as argument.

method.name: inst2dict
method.description: Convert a script class instance to a dictionary (useful for serializing).

method.name: dict2inst
method.description: Convert a previously converted instances to dictionary back into an instance. Useful for deserializing.

method.name: hash
method.description: Hashes the variable passed and returns an integer.

method.name: print_stack
method.description: Print a stack track at code location, only works when running with debugger turned on.

constants.constant: Constant that represents how many times the diameter of a circumference fits around it's perimeter.

class.name: @Global Scope
class.description: Global scope constants and variables. This is all that resides in the globals, constants regarding error codes, scancodes, property hints, etc. It's not much. Singletons are also documented here, since they can be accessed from anywhere.

Hints that the string is a range, defined as "min,max" or "min,max,step". This is valid for integers and floats.

String property is a file (so pop up a file dialog when edited). Hint string can be a set of wildcards like "*.doc".

class.name: AABB
class.description: AABB provides an 3D Axis-Aligned Bounding Box. It consists of a position and a size, and several utility functions. It is typically used for simple (fast) overlap tests.

method.name: encloses
method.description: Return true if this [AABB] completely encloses another one.

method.name: expand
method.description: Return this [AABB] expanded to include a given point.

method.name: get_area
method.description: Get the area inside the [AABB].

method.name: get_endpoint
method.description: Get the position of the 8 endpoints of the [AABB] in space.

method.name: get_longest_axis
method.description: Return the normalized longest axis of the [AABB].

method.name: get_longest_axis_index
method.description: Return the index of the longest axis of the [AABB] (according to [Vector3]::AXIS* enum).

method.name: get_longest_axis_size
method.description: Return the scalar length of the longest axis of the [AABB].

method.name: get_shortest_axis
method.description: Return the normalized shortest axis of the [AABB].

method.name: get_shortest_axis_index
method.description: Return the index of the shortest axis of the [AABB] (according to [Vector3]::AXIS* enum).

method.name: get_shortest_axis_size
method.description: Return the scalar length of the shortest axis of the [AABB].

method.name: get_support
method.description: Return the support point in a given direction. This is useful for collision detection algorithms.

method.name: grow
method.description: Return a copy of the AABB grown a given a mount of units towards all the sides.

method.name: has_no_area
method.description: Return true if the [AABB] is flat or empty.

method.name: has_no_surface
method.description: Return true if the [AABB] is empty.

method.name: has_point
method.description: Return true if the [AABB] contains a point.

method.name: intersection
method.description: Return the intersection between two [AABB]s. An empty AABB (size 0,0,0) is returned on failure.

method.name: intersects
method.description: Return true if the [AABB] overlaps with another.

method.name: intersects_plane
method.description: Return true if the AABB is at both sides of a plane.

method.name: merge
method.description: Combine this [AABB] with another one, a larger one is returned that contains both.

method.name: AABB
method.description: Optional constructor, accepts position and size.

class.name: AcceptDialog
class.description: This dialog is useful for small notifications to the user about an event. It can only be accepted or closed, with the same result.

method.name: get_ok
method.description: Return the OK Button.

method.name: get_label
method.description: Return the label used for built-in text.

method.name: set_hide_on_ok
method.description: Set whether the dialog is hidden when accepted (default true).

method.name: get_hide_on_ok
method.description: Return true if the dialog will be hidden when accepted (default true).

method.name: register_text_enter
method.description: Register a [LineEdit] in the dialog. When the enter key is pressed, the dialog will be accepted.

method.name: set_text
method.description: Set the built-in label text.

method.name: get_text
method.description: Return the built-in label text.

signal.name: confirmed
signal.description: Emitted when accepted.

signal.name: custom_action
signal.description: Emitted with a custom button is added.

class.name: AnimatedSprite
class.brief_description: Sprite node that can use multiple textures for animation.
class.description: Sprite node that can use multiple textures for animation.

method.name: set_sprite_frames
method.description: Set the [SpriteFrames] resource, which contains all frames.

method.name: get_sprite_frames
method.description: Get the [SpriteFrames] resource, which contains all frames.

method.name: set_centered
method.description: When turned on, offset at (0,0) is the center of the sprite, when off, the top-left corner is.

method.name: is_centered
method.description: Return true when centered. See [set_centered].

method.name: set_offset
method.description: Set the offset of the sprite in the node origin. Position varies depending on whether it is centered or not.

method.name: get_offset
method.description: Return the offset of the sprite in the node origin.

method.name: set_flip_h
method.description: If true, sprite is flipped horizontally.

method.name: is_flipped_h
method.description: Return true if sprite is flipped horizontally.

method.name: set_flip_v
method.description: If true, sprite is flipped vertically.

method.name: is_flipped_v
method.description: Return true if sprite is flipped vertically.

method.name: set_frame
method.description: Set the visible sprite frame index (from the list of frames inside the [SpriteFrames] resource).

method.name: get_frame
method.description: Return the visible frame index.

method.name: set_modulate
method.description: Change the color modulation (multiplication) for this sprite.

method.name: get_modulate
method.description: Return the color modulation for this sprite.

class.name: Animation
class.brief_description: Contains data used to animate everything in the engine.
class.description: An Animation resource contains data used to animate everything in the engine. Animations are divided into tracks, and each track must be linked to a node. The state of that node can be changed through time, by adding timed keys (events) to the track. [br] Animations are just data containers, and must be added to odes such as an [AnimationPlayer] or [AnimationTreePlayer] to be played back.

method.name: add_track
method.description: Add a track to the Animation. The track type must be specified as any of the values in te TYPE_* enumeration.

method.name: remove_track
method.description: Remove a track by specifying the track index.

method.name: get_track_count
method.description: Return the amount of tracks in the animation.

method.name: track_get_type
method.description: Get the type of a track.

method.name: track_get_path
method.description: Get the path of a track. for more information on the path format, see [method track_set_path]

method.name: track_set_path
method.description: Set the path of a track. Paths must be valid scene-tree paths to a node, and must be specified starting from the parent node of the node that will reproduce the animation. Tracks that control properties or bones must append their name after the path, separated by ":". Example: "character/skeleton:ankle" or "character/mesh:transform/local"

method.name: track_move_up
method.description: Move a track up.

method.name: track_move_down
method.description: Nove a track down.

method.name: transform_track_insert_key
method.description: Insert a transform key for a transform track.

method.name: track_insert_key
method.description: Insert a generic key in a given track.

method.name: track_remove_key
method.description: Remove a key by index in a given track.

method.name: track_remove_key_at_pos
method.description: Remove a key by position (seconds) in a given track.

method.name: track_set_key_value
method.description: Set the value of an existing key.

method.name: track_set_key_transition
method.description: Set the transition curve (easing) for a specific key (see built-in math function "ease").

method.name: track_get_key_transition
method.description: Return the transition curve (easing) for a specific key (see built-in math function "ease").

method.name: track_get_key_count
method.description: Return the amount of keys in a given track.

method.name: track_get_key_value
method.description: Return the value of a given key in a given track.

method.name: track_get_key_time
method.description: Return the time at which the key is located.

method.name: track_find_key
method.description: Find the key index by time in a given track. Optionally, only find it if the exact time is given.

method.name: track_set_interpolation_type
method.description: Set the interpolation type of a given track, from the INTERPOLATION_* enum.

method.name: track_get_interpolation_type
method.description: Return the interpolation type of a given track, from the INTERPOLATION_* enum.

method.name: transform_track_interpolate
method.description: Return the interpolated value of a transform track at a given time (in seconds). An array consisting of 3 elements: position ([Vector3]), rotation ([Quat]) and scale ([Vector3]).

method.name: value_track_set_continuous
method.description: Enable or disable interpolation for a whole track. By default tracks are interpolated.

method.name: value_track_is_continuous
method.description: Return wether interpolation is enabled or disabled for a whole track. By default tracks are interpolated.

method.name: value_track_get_key_indices
method.description: Return all the key indices of a value track, given a position and delta time.

method.name: method_track_get_key_indices
method.description: Return all the key indices of a method track, given a position and delta time.

method.name: method_track_get_name
method.description: Return the method name of a method track.

method.name: method_track_get_params
method.description: Return the arguments values to be called on a method track for a given key in a given track.

method.name: set_length
method.description: Set the total length of the animation (in seconds). Note that length is not delimited by the last key, as this one may be before or after the end to ensure correct interpolation and looping.

method.name: get_length
method.description: Return the total length of the animation (in seconds).

method.name: set_loop
method.description: Set a flag indicating that the animation must loop. This is uses for correct interpolation of animation cycles, and for hinting the player that it must restart the animation.

method.name: has_loop
method.description: Return wether the animation has the loop flag set.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the animation (clear all tracks and reset all).

constants.constant: Value tracks set values in node properties, but only those which can be Interpolated.
Transform tracks are used to change node local transforms or skeleton pose bones. Transitions are Interpolated.
Method tracks call functions with given arguments per key.
No interpolation (nearest value).
Linear interpolation.
Cubic interpolation.

class.name: AnimationPlayer
class.description: An animation player is used for general purpose playback of [Animation] resources. It contains a dictionary of animations (referenced by name) and custom blend times between their transitions. Additionally, animations can be played and blended in diferent channels.

method.name: add_animation
method.description: Add an animation resource to the player, which will be later referenced by the "name" argument.

method.name: remove_animation
method.description: Remove an animation from the player (by supplying the same name used to add it).

method.name: rename_animation
method.description: Rename an existing animation.

method.name: has_animation
method.description: Request wether an [Animation] name exist within the player.

method.name: get_animation
method.description: Get an [Animation] resource by requesting a name.

method.name: get_animation_list
method.description: Get the list of names of the animations stored in the player.

method.name: set_blend_time
method.description: Specify a blend time (in seconds) between two animations, referemced by their names.

method.name: get_blend_time
method.description: Get the blend time between two animations, referemced by their names.

method.name: set_default_blend_time
method.description: Set the default blend time between animations.

method.name: get_default_blend_time
method.description: Return the default blend time between animations.

method.name: play
method.description: Play a given animation by the animation name. Custom speed and blend times can be set. If custom speed is negative (-1), 'from_end' being true can play the animation backwards.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop the currently played animation.

method.name: stop_all
method.description: Stop playback of animations (deprecated).

method.name: is_playing
method.description: Return wether an animation is playing.

method.name: set_current_animation
method.description: Set the current animation (even if no playback occurs). Using set_current_animation() and set_active() are similar to calling play().

method.name: get_current_animation
method.description: Return the name of the animation being played.

method.name: queue
method.description: Queue an animation for playback once the current one is done.

method.name: clear_queue
method.description: If animations are queued to play, clear them.

method.name: set_active
method.description: Set the player as active (playing). If false, it will do nothing.

method.name: is_active
method.description: Return true if the player is active.

method.name: set_speed
method.description: Set a speed scaling ratio in a given animation channel (or channel 0 if none is provided). Default ratio is [i]1[/i] (no scaling).

method.name: get_speed
method.description: Get the speed scaling ratio in a given animation channel (or channel 0 if none is provided). Default ratio is [i]1[/i] (no scaling).

method.name: set_autoplay
method.description: Set the name of the animation that will be automatically played when the scene is loaded.

method.name: get_autoplay
method.description: Return the name of the animation that will be automatically played when the scene is loaded.

method.name: set_root
method.description: AnimationPlayer resolves animation track paths from this node (which is relative to itself), by default root is "..", but it can be changed.

method.name: get_root
method.description: Return path to root node (see [set_root]).

method.name: seek
method.description: Seek the animation to a given position in time (in seconds). If 'update' is true, the animation will be updated too, otherwise it will be updated at process time.

method.name: get_pos
method.description: Return the playback position (in seconds) in an animation channel (or channel 0 if none is provided).

method.name: find_animation
method.description: Find an animation name by resource.

method.name: clear_caches
method.description: The animation player creates caches for faster access to the nodes it will animate. However, if a specific node is removed, it may not notice it, so clear_caches will force the player to search for the nodes again.

method.name: set_animation_process_mode
method.description: Set the mode in which the animation player processes. By default, it processes on idle time (framerate dependent), but using fixed time works well for animating static collision bodies in 2D and 3D. See enum ANIMATION_PROCESS_*.

method.name: get_animation_process_mode
method.description: Return the mode in which the animation player processes. See [method set_animation_process_mode].

method.name: get_current_animation_pos
method.description: Get the position (in seconds) of the currently being played animation.

method.name: get_current_animation_length
method.description: Get the length (in seconds) of the currently being played animation.

signal.name: animation_changed
signal.description: If the currently being played animation changes, this signal will notify of such change.

signal.name: finished
signal.description: Notifies when an animation finished playing.

constants.constant: Process animation on fixed process. This is specially useful when animating kinematic bodies.
Process animation on idle process.

class.name: AnimationTreePlayer
class.brief_description: Animation Player that uses a node graph for the blending.
class.description: Animation Player that uses a node graph for the blending. This kind of player is very useful when animating character or other skeleton based rigs, because it can combine several animations to form a desired pose.

method.name: add_node
method.description: Add a node of a given type in the graph with given id.

method.name: node_exists
method.description: Check if a node exists (by name).

method.name: node_rename
method.description: Rename a node in the graph.

method.name: node_get_type
method.description: Get the node type, will return from NODE_* enum.

method.name: node_get_input_count
method.description: Return the input count for a given node. Different types of nodes have different amount of inputs.

method.name: node_get_input_source
method.description: Return the input source for a given node input.

method.name: animation_node_set_animation
method.description: Set the animation for an animation node.

class.name: Area2D
class.brief_description: General purpose area detection and influence for 2D Phisics.
class.description: General purpose area detection for 2D Phisics. Areas can be used for detection of objects that enter/exit them, as well as overriding space parameters (changing gravity, damping, etc). An Area2D can be set as a children to a RigidBody2D to generate a custom gravity field. For this, use SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE and point gravity at the center of mass.

method.name: set_gravity_is_point
method.description: When overriding space parameters, areas can have a center of gravity as a point.

method.name: is_gravity_a_point
method.description: Return if gravity is a point. When overriding space parameters, areas can have a center of gravity as a point.

method.name: set_gravity_vector
method.description: Set gravity vector. If gravity is a point, this will be the attraction center.

class.name: Array
class.description: Generic array, contains several elements of any type, accessible by numerical index starting at 0. Arrays are always passed by reference.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the array (resize to 0).

method.name: empty
method.description: Return true if the array is empty (size==0).

method.name: hash
method.description: Return a hashed integer value representing the array contents.

method.name: insert
method.description: Insert a new element at a given position in the array. The position must be valid, or at the end of the array (pos==size()).

method.name: push_back
method.description: Append an element at the end of the array.

method.name: remove
method.description: Remove an element from the array by index.

method.name: resize
method.description: Resize the array to contain a different number of elements. If the array size is smaller, elements are cleared, if bigger, new elements are Null.

method.name: size
method.description: Return the amount of elements in the array.

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [RawArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [RawArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [RawArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [RawArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [RawArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [RawArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [RawArray].

class.name: AudioServer
class.brief_description: Server interface for low level audio access.
class.description: AudioServer is a low level server interface for audio access. It is in charge of creating sample data (playable audio) as well as its playback via a voice interface.

method.name: sample_create
method.description: Create an audio sample, return a [RID] referencing it. The sample will be created with a given format (from the SAMPLE_FORMAT_* enum), a total length (in frames, not samples or bytes), in either stereo or mono.

method.name: sample_set_description
method.description: Set the description of an audio sample. Mainly used for organization.

method.name: sample_get_description
method.description: Return the description of an audio sample. Mainly used for organization.

method.name: sample_get_format
method.description: Return the format of the audio sample, in the form of the SAMPLE_FORMAT_* enum.

method.name: sample_is_stereo
method.description: Return wether the sample is stereo (2 channels)

method.name: sample_get_length
method.description: Return the length in frames of the audio sample (not samples or bytes).

method.name: sample_set_signed_data
method.description: Set the sample data for a given sample as an array of floats. The length must be equal to the sample lenght or an error will be produced.

method.name: sample_set_data
method.description: Set the sample data for a given sample as an array of bytes. The length must be equal to the sample lenght expected in bytes or an error will be produced.

method.name: sample_get_data
method.description: Return the sample data as an array of bytes. The length will be the expected length in bytes.

method.name: sample_set_mix_rate
method.description: Change the default mix rate of a given sample.

method.name: sample_get_mix_rate
method.description: Return the mix rate of the given sample.

method.name: sample_set_loop_format
method.description: Set the loop format for a sample from the SAMPLE_LOOP_* enum. As a warning, Ping Pong loops may not be available on some hardware-mixing platforms.

method.name: sample_get_loop_format
method.description: Return the loop format for a sample, as a value from the SAMPLE_LOOP_* enum.

method.name: sample_set_loop_begin
method.description: Set the initial loop point of a sample. Only has effect if sample loop is enabled. See [method sample_set_loop_format].

method.name: sample_get_loop_begin
method.description: Return the initial loop point of a sample. Only has effect if sample loop is enabled. See [method sample_set_loop_format].

method.name: sample_set_loop_end
method.description: Set the final loop point of a sample. Only has effect if sample loop is enabled. See [method sample_set_loop_format].

method.name: sample_get_loop_end
method.description: Return the final loop point of a sample. Only has effect if sample loop is enabled. See [method sample_set_loop_format].

method.name: voice_create
method.description: Allocate a voice for playback. Voices are persistent. A voice can play a single sample at the same time. See [method sample_create].

method.name: voice_play
method.description: Start playback of a given voice using a given sample. If the voice was already playing it will be restarted.

method.name: voice_set_volume
method.description: Change the volume of a currently playing voice. Volume is expressed as linear gain where 0.0 is mute and 1.0 is default.

method.name: voice_set_pan
method.description: Change the pan of a currently playing voice and, optionally, the depth and height for a positional/3D sound. Panning values are expressed within the -1 to +1 range.

method.name: voice_set_filter
method.description: Set a resonant filter post processing for the voice. Filter type is a value from the FILTER_* enum.

method.name: voice_set_chorus
method.description: Set chorus send post processing for the voice (from 0 to 1).

method.name: voice_set_reverb
method.description: Set the reverb send post processing for the voice (from 0 to 1) and the reverb type, from the REVERB_* enum.

method.name: voice_set_mix_rate
method.description: Set a different playback mix rate for the given voice.

method.name: voice_set_positional
method.description: Set wether a given voice is positional. This is only interpreted as a hint and used for backends that may support binaural encoding.

method.name: voice_get_volume
method.description: Return the current volume for a given voice.

method.name: voice_get_pan
method.description: Return the current pan for a given voice (-1 to +1 range).

method.name: voice_get_pan_height
method.description: Return the current pan height for a given voice (-1 to +1 range).

method.name: voice_get_pan_depth
method.description: Return the current pan depth for a given voice (-1 to +1 range).

method.name: voice_get_filter_type
method.description: Return the current selected filter type for a given voice, from the FILTER_* enum.

method.name: voice_get_filter_cutoff
method.description: Return the current filter cutoff (in hz) for a given voice.

method.name: voice_get_filter_resonance
method.description: Return the current filter resonance for a given voice.

method.name: voice_get_chorus
method.description: Return the current chorus send for a given voice (0 to 1).

method.name: voice_get_reverb_type
method.description: Return the current reverb type for a given voice from the REVERB_* enum.

method.name: voice_get_reverb
method.description: Return the current reverb send for a given voice (0 to 1).

method.name: voice_get_mix_rate
method.description: Return the current mix rate for a given voice.

method.name: voice_is_positional
method.description: Return wether the current voice is positional. See [method voice_set_positional].

method.name: voice_stop
method.description: Stop a given voice.

method.name: free
method.description: Free a [RID] resource.

method.name: set_stream_global_volume_scale
method.description: Set global scale for stream playback. Default is 1.0.

method.name: get_stream_global_volume_scale
method.description: Return the global scale for stream playback.

constants.constant: Sample format is 8 bits, signed.
Sample format is 16 bits, signed.
Sample format is IMA-ADPCM compressed.
Sample does not loop.
Sample loops in forward mode.
Sample loops in a bidirectional way.
Filter is disabled.
Filter is a resonant lowpass.
Filter is a resonant bandpass.
Filter is a resonant highpass.
Filter is a notch (band reject).
Filter is a bandlimit (resonance used as highpass).
Small reverb room (closet, bathroom, etc).
Medium reverb room (living room)
Large reverb room (warehouse).
Large reverb room with long decay.

class.name: AudioStream
class.description: Base class for audio streams. Audio streams are used for music playback, or other types of streamed sounds that don't fit or requiere more flexibility than a [Sample].

method.name: play
method.description: Start playback of an audio stream.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop playback of an audio stream.

method.name: is_playing

method.name: set_loop
method.description: Set the loop hint for the audio stream playback. if true, audio stream will attempt to loop (restart) when finished.

method.name: has_loop

method.name: get_stream_name

method.name: get_pos

method.name: get_update_mode
method.description: Return the type of update that the stream uses. Some types of stream may need manual polling.

method.name: update
method.description: Manually poll the audio stream (if it is requested to).

constants.constant: Does not need update, or manual polling.
Stream is updated on the main thread, when idle.
Stream is updated on its own thread.

class.name: AudioStreamGibberish

class.description: Base class for resampled audio streams.

class.name: BaseButton
class.brief_description: Provides a base class for different kinds of buttons.
class.description: BaseButton is the abstract base class for buttons, so it shouldn't be used directly (It doesnt display anything). Other types of buttons inherit from it.

method.name: set_pressed
method.description: Set the button to pressed state (only if toggle_mode is active).

method.name: is_pressed
method.description: Return when the button is pressed (only if toggle_mode is active).

method.name: set_toggle_mode
method.description: Set the button toggle_mode property. Toggle mode makes the button flip state between pressed and unpressed each time its area is clicked.

method.name: is_toggle_mode
method.description: Return the toggle_mode property (see [method set_toggle_mode]).

method.name: set_disabled
method.description: Set the button into disabled state. When a button is disabled, it can't be clicked or toggled.

method.name: is_disabled
method.description: Return wether the button is in disabled state (see [method set_disabled]).

method.name: set_click_on_press
method.description: Set the button click_on_press mode. This mode generates click events when a mousebutton or key is just pressed (by default events are generated when the button/keys are released and both press and release occur in the visual area of the Button).

method.name: get_click_on_press
method.description: Return the state of the click_on_press property (see [method set_click_on_press]).

method.name: get_draw_mode
method.description: Return the visual state used to draw the button. This is useful mainly when implementing your own draw code by either overiding _draw() or connecting to "draw" signal. The visual state of the button is defined by the DRAW_* enum.

signal.name: toggled
signal.description: This signal is emitted when the button was just toggled between pressed and normal states (only if toggle_mode is active). The new state is contained in the [i]pressed[/i] argument.

signal.name: pressed
signal.description: This signal is emitted every time the button is pressed or toggled.

method.description: Return the icon of an existing button.

signal.name: button_selected

constants.constant: Align buttons at the begining.
Align buttons in the middle.

class.name: Camera
class.brief_description: Camera node, displays from a point of view.
class.description: Camera is a special node that displays what is visible from its current location. Cameras register themselves in the nearest [Viewport] node (when ascending the tree). Only one camera can be active per viewport. If no viewport is available ascending the tree, the Camera will register in the global viewport. In other words, a Camera just provides [i]3D[/i] display capabilities to a [Viewport], and, without one, a [Scene] registered in that [Viewport] (or higher viewports) can't be displayed.

method.name: project_ray_normal
method.description: Return a normal vector in worldspace, that is the result of projecting a point on the [Viewport] rectangle by the camera projection. This is useful for casting rays in the form of (origin,normal) for object intersection or picking.

method.name: project_ray_origin
method.description: Return a 3D position in worldspace, that is the result of projecting a point on the [Viewport] rectangle by the camera projection. This is useful for casting rays in the form of (origin,normal) for object intersection or picking.

method.name: unproject_position
method.description: Return how a 3D point in worldpsace maps to a 2D coordinate in the [Viewport] rectangle.

method.name: set_perspective
method.description: Set the camera projection to perspective mode, by specifying a [i]FOV[/i] Y angle in degrees (FOV means Field of View), and the [i]near[/i] and [i]far[/i] clip planes in worldspace units.

method.name: set_orthogonal
method.description: Set the camera projection to orthogonal mode, by specifying a width and the [i]near[/i] and [i]far[/i] clip planes in worldspace units. (As a hint, 2D games often use this projection, with values specified in pixels)

method.name: make_current
method.description: Make this camera the current Camera for the [Viewport] (see class description). If the Camera Node is outside the scene tree, it will attempt to become current once it's added.

method.name: is_current
method.description: Return wether the Camera is the current one in the [Viewport], or plans to become current (if outside the scene tree).

method.name: get_camera_transform
method.description: Get the camera transform. Subclassed cameras (such as CharacterCamera) may provide different transforms than the [Node] transform.

constants.constant: Perspective Projection (object's size on the screen becomes smaller when far away).
Orthogonal Projection (objects remain the same size on the screen no matter how far away they are).

class.name: Camera2D
class.description: Camera node for 2D scenes. It forces the screen (current layer) to scroll following this node. This makes it easier (and faster) to program scrollable scenes than manually changing the position of [CanvasItem] based nodes. This node is intended to be a simple helper get get things going quickly and it may happen often that more functionality is desired to change how the camera works. To make your own custom camera node, simply inherit from [Node2D] and change the transform of the canvas by calling get_viewport().set_canvas_transform(m) in [Viewport].

method.name: set_offset
method.description: Set the scroll offset. Useful for looking around or camera shake animations.

method.name: get_offset
method.description: Return the scroll offset.

method.name: set_centered
method.description: Set to true if the camera is at the center of the screen (default: true).

method.name: is_centered
method.description: Return true if the camera is at the center of the screen (default: true).

method.name: make_current
method.description: Make this the current 2D camera for the scene (viewport and layer), in case there's many cameras in the scene.

method.name: is_current
method.description: Return true of this is the current camera (see [method Camera2D.make_current]).

method.name: set_limit
method.description: Set the scrolling limit in pixels.

method.name: get_limit
method.description: Return the scrolling limit in pixels.

method.name: set_drag_margin
method.description: Set the margins needed to drag the camera (relative to the screen size). Margin uses the MARGIN_* enum. Drag margins of 0,0,0,0 will keep the camera at the center of the screen, while drag margins of 1,1,1,1 will only move when the camera is at the edges.

method.name: get_drag_margin
method.description: Return the margins needed to drag the camera (see [method set_drag_margin]).

method.name: get_camera_pos
method.description: Return the camera position.

method.name: force_update_scroll
method.description: Force the camera to update scroll immediately.

class.name: CanvasItem
class.description: Base class of anything 2D. Canvas items are laid out in a tree and children inherit and extend the transform of their parent. CanvasItem is extended by [Control], for anything GUI related, and by [Node2D] for anything 2D engine related. Any CanvasItem can draw. For this, the "update" function must be called, then NOTIFICATION_DRAW will be received on idle time to request redraw. Because of this, canvas items don't need to be redraw on every frame, improving the performance significan'tly. Several functions for drawing on the CanvasItem are provided (see draw_* functions). They can only be used inside the notification, signal or _draw() overrided function, though. Canvas items are draw in tree order. By default, children are on top of their parents so a root CanvasItem will be drawn behind everything (this can be changed per item though). Canvas items can also be hidden (hiding also their subtree). They provide many means for changing standard parameters such as opacity (for it and the subtree) and self opacity, blend mode. Ultimately, a transform notification can be requested, which will notify the node that its global position changed in case the parent tree changed.

method.name: _draw
method.description: Called (if exists) to draw the canvas item.

method.name: edit_set_state
method.description: Used for editing, returns an opaque value represeting the transform state.

method.name: edit_rotate
method.description: Used for editing, handle rotation.

method.name: get_item_rect
method.description: Return a rect containing the editable contents of the item.

method.name: get_canvas_item
method.description: Return the canvas item RID used by [VisualServer] for this item.

method.name: is_visible
method.description: Return true if this CanvasItem is visible. It may be invisible because itself or a parent canvas item is hidden.

method.name: is_hidden
method.description: Return true if this CanvasItem is hidden. Note that the CanvasItem may not be visible, but as long as it's not hidden ([method hide] called) the function will return false.

method.name: show
method.description: Show the CanvasItem currently hidden.

method.name: hide
method.description: Hide the CanvasItem currently visible.

method.name: update
method.description: Queue the CanvasItem for update. NOTIFICATION_DRAW will be called on idle time to request redraw.

method.name: set_as_toplevel
method.description: Set as toplevel. This means that it will not inherit transform from parent canvas items.

method.name: is_set_as_toplevel
method.description: Return if set as toplevel. See [method set_as_toplevel]/

method.name: set_blend_mode
method.description: Set the blending mode from enum BLEND_MODE_*.

method.name: get_blend_mode
method.description: Return the current blending mode from enum BLEND_MODE_*.

method.name: set_opacity
method.description: Set canvas item opacity. This will affect the canvas item and all the children.

method.name: get_opacity
method.description: Return the canvas item opacity. This affects the canvas item and all the children.

method.name: set_self_opacity
method.description: Set canvas item self-opacity. This does not affect the opacity of children items.

method.name: get_self_opacity
method.description: Return the canvas item self-opacity.

method.name: set_draw_behind_parent
method.description: Sets whether the canvas item is drawn behind its parent.

method.name: is_draw_behind_parent_enabled
method.description: Return whether the item is drawn behind its parent.

method.name: draw_line
method.description: Draw a line from a 2D point to another, with a given color and width.

method.name: draw_rect
method.description: Draw a colored rectangle.

method.name: draw_circle
method.description: Draw a colored circle.

method.name: draw_texture
method.description: Draw a texture at a given position.

method.name: draw_texture_rect
method.description: Draw a textured rectangle at a given position, optionally modulated by a color. Transpose swaps the x and y coordinates when reading the texture.

method.name: draw_texture_rect_region
method.description: Draw a textured rectangle region at a given position, optionally modulated by a color. Transpose swaps the x and y coordinates when reading the texture.

method.name: draw_style_box
method.description: Draw a styled rectangle.

method.name: draw_primitive
method.description: Draw a custom primitive, 1 point for a point, 2 points for a line, 3 points for a triangle and 4 points for a quad.

method.name: draw_polygon
method.description: Draw a polygon of any amount of points, convex or concave.

method.name: draw_colored_polygon
method.description: Draw a colored polygon of any amount of points, convex or concave.

method.name: draw_string
method.description: Draw a string using a custom font.

method.name: draw_char
method.description: Draw a string character using a custom font. Returns the advance, depending on the char width and kerning with an optional next char.

method.name: draw_set_transform
method.description: Set a custom transform for drawing. Anything drawn afterwards will be transformed by this.

signal.name: item_rect_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the intem rect has changed.

signal.name: draw
signal.description: Emitted when the CanvasItem must redraw. This can only be connected realtime, as deferred will not allow drawing.

signal.name: visibility_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the visibility (hidden/visible) changes.

signal.name: hide
signal.description: Emitted when becoming hidden.

constants.constant: Mix blending mode. Colors are assumed to be independent of the alpha (opacity) value.
Additive blending mode.
Substractive blending mode.
Multiplicative blending mode.
Mix blending mode. Colors are assumed to be premultiplied by the alpha (opacity) value.
CanvasItem is requested to draw.

class.name: CanvasLayer
class.description: Canvas Item layer. [CanvasItem] nodes that are direct or indirect children of a [CanvasLayer] will be drawn in that layer. The layer is a numeric index that defines the draw order. The default 2D scene renders with index 0, so a [CanvasLayer] with index -1 will be drawn below, and one with index 1 will be drawn above. This is very useful for HUDs (in layer 1+ or above), or backgrounds (in layer -1 or below).

method.name: set_layer
method.description: Set the layer index, determines the draw order, a lower value will be below a higher one.

method.name: get_layer
method.description: Return the layer index, determines the draw order, a lower value will be below a higher one.

method.name: get_rotation
method.description: Return the base rotation for this layer (helper).

method.name: set_scale
method.description: Set the base scale for this layer (helper).

method.name: get_scale
method.description: Return the base scale for this layer (helper).

method.description: Append a value to the array.

method.name: resize
method.description: Resize the array.

method.name: set
method.description: Set an index in the array.

method.name: size
method.description: Return the array size.

method.name: ColorArray
method.description: Create from a generic array.

class.name: ColorPicker
class.description: This is a simple color picker [Control]. It's useful for selecting a color from an RGB/RGBA colorspace.

method.name: set_color
method.description: Select the current color.

method.name: get_color

signal.name: color_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the color changes.

class.name: ConcavePolygonShape
class.description: Concave polygon shape resource, which can be set into a [PhysicsBody] or area. This shape is created by feeding a list of triangles.

method.name: set_faces
method.description: Set the faces (an array of triangles).

method.name: get_faces
method.description: Return the faces (an array of triangles).

class.name: ConcavePolygonShape2D
class.brief_description: Concave polygon 2D shape resource for physics.
class.description: Concave polygon 2D shape resource for physics. It is made out of segments and is very optimal for complex polygonal concave collisions. It is really not advised to use for RigidBody nodes. A CollisionPolygon2D in convex decomposition mode (solids) or several convex objects are advised for that instead. Otherwise, a concave polygon 2D shape is better for static collisions.

method.name: set_segments
method.description: Set the array of segments.

method.name: get_segments
method.description: Return the array of segments.

class.name: ConfirmationDialog
class.description: Dialog for confirmation of actions. This dialog inherits from [AcceptDialog], but has by default an OK and Cancel buton (in host OS order).

method.name: get_cancel
method.description: Return the cancel button.

class.name: Container
class.description: Base node for conainers. A [Container] contains other controls and automatically arranges them in a certain way. A Control can inherit this to reate custom container classes.

method.name: queue_sort
method.description: Queue resort of the contained children. This is called automatically anyway, but can be called upon request.

method.name: fit_child_in_rect
method.description: Fit a child control in a given rect. This is mainly a helper for creating custom container classes.

signal.name: sort_children
signal.description: Enmitted when sorting the children is needed.

constants.constant: Notification for when sorting the children, it must be obeyed immediately.

class.name: Control
class.brief_description: Control is the base node for all the GUI components.
class.description: Control is the base class Node for all the GUI components. Every GUI component inherits from it, directly or indirectly. In this way, sections of the scene tree made of contiguous control nodes, become user interfaces. Controls are relative to the parent position and size by using anchors and margins. This ensures that they can adapt easily in most situation to changing dialog and screen sizes. When more flexibility is desired, [Container] derived nodes can be used. Anchors work by defining which margin do they follow, and a value relative to it. Allowed anchoring modes are ANCHOR_BEGIN, where the margin is relative to the top or left margins of the parent (in pixels), ANCHOR_END for the right and bottom margins of the parent and ANCHOR_RATIO, which is a ratio from 0 to 1 in the parent range. Input device events ([InputEvent]) are first sent to the root controls via the [method Node._input], which distribute it through the tree, then delivers them to the adequate one (under cursor or keyboard focus based) by calling [Node._input_event]. There is no need to enable input processing on controls to receive such events. To ensure that no one else will receive the event (not even [method Node._unhandled_input]), the control can accept it by calling [method accept_event]. Only one control can hold the keyboard focus (receiving keyboard events), for that the control must define the focus mode with [method set_focus_mode]. Focus is lost when another control gains it, or the current focus owner is hidden. It is sometimes desired for a control to ignore mouse/pointer events. This is often the case when placing other controls on top of a button, in such cases. Calling [method set_ignore_mouse] enables this function. Finally, controls are skinned according to a [Theme]. Setting a [Theme] on a control will propagate all the skinning down the tree. Optionally, skinning can be overrided per each control by calling the add_*_override functions, or from the editor.

method.name: _input_event
method.description: Called when an input event reaches the control.

method.name: get_minimum_size
method.description: Return the minimum size this Control can shrink to. A control will never be displayed or resized smaller than its minimum size.

method.name: accept_event
method.description: Handles the event, no other control will receive it and it will not be sent to nodes waiting on [method Node._unhandled_input] or [method Node._unhandled_key_input].

method.name: get_minimum_size
method.description: Return the minimum size this Control can shrink to. A control will never be displayed or resized smaller than its minimum size.

method.name: is_window
method.description: Return wether this control is a [i]window[/i]. Controls are considered windows when their parent [Node] is not a Control.

method.name: get_window
method.description: Return the [i]window[/i] for this control, ascending the scene tree (see [method is_window]).

method.name: set_anchor
method.description: Change the anchor (ANCHOR_BEGIN, ANCHOR_END, ANCHOR_RATIO) type for a margin (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM). Changing the anchor mode converts the current margin offset from the previos anchor mode to the new one, so margin offsets ([method set_margin]) must be done after setting anchors, or at the same time ([method set_anchor_and_margin]).

method.name: get_anchor
method.description: Return the anchor type (ANCHOR_BEGIN, ANCHOR_END, ANCHOR_RATIO) for a given margin (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM).

method.name: set_margin
method.description: Set a margin offset. Margin can be one of (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM). Offset value being set depends on the anchor mode.

method.name: set_anchor_and_margin
method.description: Change the anchor (ANCHOR_BEGIN, ANCHOR_END, ANCHOR_RATIO) type for a margin (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM), and also set its offset. This is a helper (see [method set_anchor] and [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_begin
method.description: Sets MARGIN_LEFT and MARGIN_TOP at the same time. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_end
method.description: Sets MARGIN_RIGHT and MARGIN_BOTTOM at the same time. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_pos
method.description: Move the Control to a new position, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control, changing all margins if needed and without changing current anchor mode. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_size
method.description: Changes MARGIN_RIGHT and MARGIN_BOTTOM to fit a given size. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_global_pos
method.description: Move the Control to a new position, relative to the top-left corner of the [i]window[/i] Control, and without changing current anchor mode. (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: get_margin
method.description: Return a margin offset. Margin can be one of (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM). Offset value being returned depends on the anchor mode.

method.name: get_end
method.description: Returns MARGIN_LEFT and MARGIN_TOP at the same time. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: get_pos
method.description: Returns the Control position, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control and independly of the anchor mode.

method.name: get_size
method.description: Returns the size of the Control, computed from all margins, however the size returned will [b]never be smaller than the minimum size reported by [method get_minimum_size][/b]. This means that even if end position of the Control rectangle is smaller than the begin position, the Control will still display and interact correctly. (see description, [method get_minimum_size], [method set_margin], [method set_anchor]).

method.name: get_global_pos
method.description: Returns the Control position, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control and independent of the anchor mode.

method.name: get_rect
method.description: Return position and size of the Control, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control. This is a helper (see [method get_pos],[method get_size]).

method.name: get_global_rect
method.description: Return position and size of the Control, relative to the top-left corner of the [i]window[/i] Control. This is a helper (see [method get_global_pos],[method get_size]).

method.name: set_area_as_parent_rect
method.description: Change all margins and anchors, so this Control always takes up the same area as the parent Control. This is a helper (see [method set_anchor],[method set_margin]).

method.name: show_modal
method.description: Display a Control as modal. Control must be a subwindow (see [method set_as_subwindow]). Modal controls capture the input signals until closed or the area outside them is accessed. When a modal control loses focus, or the ESC key is pressed, they automatically hide. Modal controls are used extensively for popup dialogs and menus.

method.name: set_focus_mode
method.description: Set the focus access mode for the control (FOCUS_NONE, FOCUS_CLICK, FOCUS_ALL). Only one Control can be focused at the same time, and it will receive keyboard signals.

method.name: has_focus
method.description: Return wether the Control is the current focused control (see [method set_focus_mode]).

method.name: grab_focus
method.description: Steal the focus from another control and become the focused control (see [method set_focus_mode]).

method.name: release_focus
method.description: Give up the focus, no other control will be able to receive keyboard input.

method.name: get_focus_owner
method.description: Return which control is owning the keyboard focus, or null if no one.

method.name: set_h_size_flags
method.description: Hint for containers, set horizontal positioning flags.

method.name: get_h_size_flags
method.description: Hint for containers, return horizontal positioning flags.

method.name: set_stretch_ratio
method.description: Hint for containers, set the stretch ratio. This value is relative to other stretch ratio, so if this control has 2 and another has 1, this one will be twice as big.

method.name: get_stretch_ratio
method.description: Hint for containers, return the stretch ratio. This value is relative to other stretch ratio, so if this control has 2 and another has 1, this one will be twice as big.

method.name: set_v_size_flags
method.description: Hint for containers, set vertical positioning flags.

method.name: get_v_size_flags
method.description: Hint for containers, return vertical positioning flags.

method.name: set_theme
method.description: Override whole the [Theme] for this Control and all its children controls.

method.name: get_theme
method.description: Return a [Theme] override, if one exists (see [method set_theme]).

method.name: add_icon_override
method.description: Override a single icon ([Texture]) in the theme of this Control. If texture is empty, override is cleared.

method.name: add_style_override
method.description: Override a single stylebox ([Stylebox]) in the theme of this Control. If stylebox is empty, override is cleared.

method.name: add_font_override
method.description: Override a single font (font) in the theme of this Control. If font is empty, override is cleared.

method.name: add_constant_override
method.description: Override a single constant (integer) in the theme of this Control. If constant equals Theme.INVALID_CONSTANT, override is cleared.

method.name: set_tooltip
method.description: Set a tooltip, which will appear when the cursor is resting over this control.

method.name: get_tooltip
method.description: Return the tooltip, which will appear when the cursor is resting over this control.

method.name: set_default_cursor_shape
method.description: Set the default cursor shape for this control. See enum CURSOR_* for the list of shapes.

method.name: get_default_cursor_shape
method.description: Return the default cursor shape for this control. See enum CURSOR_* for the list of shapes.

method.name: get_cursor_shape
method.description: Return the cursor shape at a certain position in the control.

method.name: set_focus_neighbour
method.description: Force a neighbour for moving the input focus to. When pressing TAB or directional/joypad directions focus is moved to the next control in that direction. However, the neighbour to move to can be forced with this function.

method.name: get_focus_neighbour
method.description: Return the forced neighbour for moving the input focus to. When pressing TAB or directional/joypad directions focus is moved to the next control in that direction. However, the neighbour to move to can be forced with this function.

method.name: set_ignore_mouse
method.description: Ignore mouse events on this control (even touchpad events send mouse events).

method.name: is_ignoring_mouse
method.description: Return if the control is ignoring mouse events (even touchpad events send mouse events).

signal.name: focus_enter
signal.description: Emitted when keyboard focus is gained.

signal.name: mouse_enter
signal.description: Emitted when the mouse enters the control area.

signal.name: resized
signal.description: Emitted when the control changed size.

signal.name: minimum_size_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the minimum size of the control changed.

signal.name: size_flags_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the size flags changed.

signal.name: focus_exit
signal.description: Emitted when the keyboard focus is lost.

signal.name: input_event
signal.description: Emitted when an input event is received. Connecting in realtime is recommended for accepting the events.

signal.name: mouse_exit
signal.description: Emitted when the mouse left the control area.

constants.constant: X is relative to MARGIN_LEFT, Y is relative to MARGIN_TOP.
X is relative to -MARGIN_RIGHT, Y is relative to -MARGIN_BOTTOM.
X and Y are a ratio (0 to 1) relative to the parent size 0 is left/top, 1 is right/bottom.
Control can't acquire focus.
Control can acquire focus only if clicked.
Control can acquire focus if clicked, or by pressing TAB/Directionals in the keyboard from another Control.
Control changed size (get_size() reports the new size).
Mouse pointer entered the area of the Control.
Mouse pointer exited the area of the Control.
Control gained focus.
Control lost focus.
Theme changed. Redrawing is desired.
Modal control was closed.

method.name: get_length

method.name: get_rest_length

method.name: set_stiffness

method.name: get_stiffness
method.description: Return the stiffness of the spring joint.

method.name: set_damping

method.name: get_damping
method.description: Return the damping of the spring joint.

class.name: Dictionary
class.description: Dictionary type. Associative container which contains values referenced by unique keys. Dictionaries are always passed by reference.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the dictionary, removing all key/value pairs.

method.name: empty
method.description: Return true if the dictionary is empty.

method.name: erase
method.description: Erase a dictionary key/value pair by key.

method.name: has
method.description: Return true if the dictionary has a given key.

method.name: hash
method.description: Return a hashed integer value representing the dictionary contents.

method.name: keys
method.description: Return the list of keys in the dictionary.

method.name: size
method.description: Return the size of the dictionary (in pairs).

class.name: DirectionalLight
class.brief_description: Directional Light, such as the Sun or the Moon.
class.description: A DirectionalLight is a type of [Light] node that emits light constantly in one direction (the negative z axis of the node). It is used lights with strong intensity that are located far away from the scene to model sunlight or moonlight. The worldpace location of the DirectionalLight transform (origin) is ignored, only the basis is used do determine light direction.

class.name: FileDialog
class.brief_description: Dialog for selecting files or directories in the filesystem.
class.description: FileDialog is a preset dialog used to choose files and directories in the filesystem. It supports filter masks.

method.name: clear_filters
method.description: Clear all the added filters in the dialog.

method.name: add_filter
method.description: Add a custom filter. Filter format is: "mask ; description", example (C++): dialog->add_filter("*.png ; PNG Images");

method.name: get_current_dir
method.description: Get the current working directory of the file dialog.

method.name: get_current_file
method.description: Get the current selected file of the file dialog (empty if none).

method.name: get_current_path
method.description: Get the current selected path (directory and file) of the file dialog (empty if none).

method.name: set_mode
method.description: Set the file dialog mode from the MODE_* enum.

method.name: get_mode
method.description: Get the file dialog mode from the MODE_* enum.

signal.name: file_selected
signal.description: Event emitted when the user selects a file (double clicks it or presses the OK button).

constants.constant: The dialog allows the selection of one, and only one file.
The dialog allows the selection of multiple files.
The dialog functions as a folder selector, disallowing the selection of any file.
The dialog will warn when a file exists.

class.name: FixedMaterial
class.brief_description: Simple Material with a fixed parameter set.
class.description: FixedMaterial is a simple type of material [Resource], which contains a fixed amount of paramters. It is the only type of material supported in fixed-pipeline devices and APIs. It is also an often a better alternative to [ShaderMaterial] for most simple use cases.

method.name: set_parameter
method.description: Set a parameter, parameters are defined in the PARAM_* enum. The type of each parameter may change, so it's best to check the enum.

method.name: get_parameter
method.description: Return a parameter, parameters are defined in the PARAM_* enum. The type of each parameter may change, so it's best to check the enum.

method.name: set_texture
method.description: Set a texture. Textures change parameters per texel and are mapped to the model depending on the texcoord mode (see [method set_texcoord_mode]).

method.name: get_texture
method.description: Return a texture. Textures change parameters per texel and are mapped to the model depending on the texcoord mode (see [method set_texcoord_mode]).

method.name: set_texcoord_mode
method.description: Set the texture coordinate mode. Each texture param (from the PARAM_* enum) has one. It defines how the textures are mapped to the object.

method.name: get_texcoord_mode
method.description: Return the texture coordinate mode. Each texture param (from the PARAM_* enum) has one. It defines how the textures are mapped to the object.

method.name: set_uv_transform
method.description: Sets a special transform used to post-transform UV coordinates of the uv_xfrom tecoord mode: TEXCOORD_UV_TRANSFORM.

method.name: get_uv_transform
method.description: Returns the special transform used to post-transform UV coordinates of the uv_xfrom tecoord mode: TEXCOORD_UV_TRANSFORM.

constants.constant: Diffuse Lighting (light scattered from surface).
Detail Layer for diffuse lighting.
Specular Lighting (light reflected from the surface).
Emission Lighting (light emitted from the surface).
Specular Exponent (size of the specular dot).
Glow (Visible emitted scattered light).
Normal Map (irregularity map).
Maximum amount of parameters.
Read texture coordinates from the UV array.
Read texture coordinates from the UV array and transform them by uv_xform.
Read texture coordinates from the UV2 array.

class.name: Font
class.brief_description: Internationalized font and text drawing support.
class.description: Font contains an unicode compatible character set, as well as the ability to draw it with variable width, ascent, descent and kerning. For creating fonts from TTF files (or other font formats), see the editor support for fonts. TODO check wikipedia for graph of ascent/baseline/descent/height/etc.

method.name: set_height
method.description: Set the total font height (ascent plus descent) in pixels.

method.name: get_height
method.description: Return the total font height (ascent plus descent) in pixels.

method.name: set_ascent
method.description: Set the font ascent (number of pixels above the baseline).

method.name: get_ascent
method.description: Return the font ascent (number of pixels above the baseline).

method.name: get_descent
method.description: Return the font descent (number of pixels below the baseline).

method.name: add_kerning_pair
method.description: Add a kerning pair to the [Font] as a difference. Kerning pairs are special cases where a typeface advance is determined by the next character.

method.name: get_kerning_pair
method.description: Return a kerning pair as a difference. Kerning pairs are special cases where a typeface advance is determined by the next character.

method.name: add_texture
method.description: Add a texture to the [Font].

method.name: add_char
method.description: Add a character to the font, where "character" is the unicode value, "texture" is the texture index, "rect" is the region in the texture (in pixels!), "align" is the (optional) alignment for the character and "advance" is the (optional) advance.

method.name: get_char_size
method.description: Return the size of a character, optionally taking kerning into account if the next character is provided.

method.name: get_string_size
method.description: Return the size of a string, taking kerning and advance into account.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear all the font data.

method.name: draw
method.description: Draw "string" into a canvas item using the font at a given "pos" position, with "modulate" color, and optionally clipping the width. "pos" specifies te baseline, not the top. To draw from the top, [i]ascent[/i] must be added to the Y axis.

method.name: draw_char
method.description: Draw character "char" into a canvas item using the font at a given "pos" position, with "modulate" color, and optionally kerning if "next" is apassed. clipping the width. "pos" specifies te baseline, not the top. To draw from the top, [i]ascent[/i] must be added to the Y axis. The width used by the character is returned, making this function useful for drawing strings character by character.

class.name: GeometryInstance
class.brief_description: Base node for geometry based visual instances.
class.description: Base node for geometry based visual instances. Shares some common functionality like visibility and custom materials.

method.name: set_material_override
method.description: Set the material override for the whole geometry.

method.name: get_material_override
method.description: Return the material override for the whole geometry.

class.name: Globals
class.brief_description: Contains global variables accessible from everywhere.
class.description: Contains global variables accessible from everywhere. Use the normal [Object] API, such as "Globals.get(variable)", "Globals.set(variable,value)" or "Globals.has(variable)" to access them. Variables stored in engine.cfg are also loaded into globals, making this object very useful for reading custom game configuration options.

method.name: has
method.description: Return true if a configuration value is present.

method.name: set_order
method.description: Set the order of a configuration value (influences when saved to the config file).

method.name: get_order
method.description: Return the order of a configuration value (influences when saved to the config file).

method.name: set_persisting
method.description: If set to true, this value can be saved to the configuration file. This is useful for editors.

method.name: is_persisting
method.description: If returns true, this value can be saved to the configuration file. This is useful for editors.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the whole configuration (not recommended, may break things).

method.name: localize_path
method.description: Convert a path to a localized path (res:// path).

method.name: globalize_path
method.description: Convert a localized path (res://) to a full native OS path.

class.name: GrooveJoint2D
class.description: Groove constraint for 2D physics. This is useful for making a body "slide" through a segment placed in another.

method.name: set_length
method.description: Set the length of the groove.

method.name: get_length

method.name: set_initial_offset
method.description: Set the initial offset of the groove on body A.

method.name: get_initial_offset
method.description: Set the final offset of the groove on body A.

class.name: HBoxContainer
class.description: Horizontal box container. See [BoxContainer].

class.name: HButtonArray
class.description: Horizontal button array. See [ButtonArray].

class.name: HScrollBar
class.description: Horizontal scroll bar. See [ScrollBar]. This one goes from left (min) to right (max).

class.name: HSeparator
class.description: Horizontal separator. See [Separator]. It is used to separate objects vertiacally, though (but it looks horizontal!).

class.name: HSlider
class.description: Horizontal slider. See [Slider]. This one goes from left (min) to right (max).

class.name: HSplitContainer
class.description: Horizontal split container. See [SplitContainer]. This goes from left to right.

class.name: IP
class.description: IP contains some support functions for the IPv4 protocol. TCP/IP support is in different classes (see [TCP_Client], [TCP_Server]). IP provides hostname resolution support, both blocking and threaded.

method.name: resolve_hostname
method.description: Resolve a given hostname, blocking. Resolved hostname is returned as an IP.

method.name: resolve_hostname_queue_item
method.description: Create a queue item for resolving a given hostname. The queue ID is returned, or RESOLVER_INVALID_ID on error.

method.name: get_resolve_item_status
method.description: Return the status of hostname queued for resolving, given it's queue ID. Returned status can be any of the RESOLVER_STATUS_* enumeration.

method.name: get_resolve_item_address
method.description: Return a resolved item address, or an empty string if an error happened or resolution didn't happen yet (see [method get_resolve_item_status]).

method.name: erase_resolve_item
method.description: Erase a queue ID, removing it from the queue if needed. This should be used after a queue is completed to free it and enable more queries to happen.

class.name: Image
class.description: Built in native image datatype. Contains image data, which can be converted to a texture, and several functions to interact with it.

method.name: get_mouse_pos
method.description: Return the global, unscaled, screen pointer coordinates. If the 2D viewport has been scaled, it may not work well with [Camera] or controls.

class.name: InputEvent

Depending on it's type, the members contained can be different, so read the documentation well!. Input events can also represent actions (editable from the project settings).

method.name: is_echo
method.description: Return if this input event is an echo event (usually for key events).

method.name: is_pressed
method.description: Return if this input event is pressed (for key, mouse, joy button or screen press events).

Key event.
Mouse motion event.
Mouse button event.
Jostick motion event.
Joystick button event.

method.name: set

class.name: Joint2D
class.brief_description: Base node for all joint constraints in 2D phyisics.
class.description: Base node for all joint constraints in 2D phyisics. Joints take 2 bodies and apply a custom constraint.

method.name: set_node_a
method.description: Set the path to the A node for the joint. Must be of type PhysicsBody2D.

method.name: get_node_a
method.description: Return the path to the A node for the joint.

method.name: set_node_b
method.description: Set the path to the B node for the joint. Must be of type PhysicsBody2D.

method.name: get_node_b
method.description: Return the path to the B node for the joint.

class.name: Label
class.description: Label is a control that displays formatted text, optionally autowrapping it to the [Control] area. It inherits from range to be able to scroll wrapped text vertically.

method.name: set_align
method.description: Set the alignmend mode to any of the ALIGN_* enumeration values.

method.name: get_align
method.description: Return the alignmend mode (any of the ALIGN_* enumeration values).

method.name: set_text
method.description: Set the label text. Text can contain newlines.

method.name: get_text
method.description: Return the label text. Text can contain newlines.

method.name: set_autowrap
method.description: Set [i]autowrap[/i] mode. When enabled, autowrap will fit text to the control width, breaking sentences when they exceed the available horizontal space. When disabled, the label minimum width becomes the width of the longest row, and the minimum height large enough to fit all rows.

method.name: has_autowrap
method.description: Return the state of the [i]autowrap[/i] mode (see [method set_autowrap]).

method.name: get_line_height
method.description: Return the height of a line.

method.name: get_line_count
method.description: Return the amount of lines.

constants.constant: Align rows to the left (default).
Align rows centered.
Align rows to the right (default).
Expand row whitespaces to fit the width.
Align the whole text to the top.
Align the whole text to the center.
Align the whole text to the bottom.
Align the whole text by spreading the rows.

class.name: Light
class.brief_description: Provides a base class for different kinds of light nodes.
class.description: Light is the abstract base class for light nodes, so it shouldn't be used directly (It can't be instanced). Other types of light nodes inherit from it. Light contains the common variables and parameters used for lighting.

class.name: LineEdit
class.brief_description: Control that provides single line string editing.
class.description: LineEdit provides a single line string editor, used for text fields.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the [LineEdit] text.

method.name: select_all
method.description: Select the whole string.

method.name: set_text
method.description: Set the text in the [LineEdit], clearing the existing one and the selection.

method.name: get_text
method.description: Return the text in the [LineEdit].

method.name: set_cursor_pos
method.description: Set the cursor position inside the [LineEdit], causing it to scroll if needed.

method.name: get_cursor_pos
method.description: Return the cursor position inside the [LineEdit].

method.name: set_max_length
method.description: Set the maximum amount of characters the [LineEdit] can edit, and cropping existing text in case it exceeds that limit. Setting 0 removes the limit.

method.name: get_max_length
method.description: Return the maximum amount of characters the [LineEdit] can edit. If 0 is returned, no limit exists.

method.name: append_at_cursor
method.description: Append text at cursor, scrolling the [LineEdit] when needed.

method.name: set_editable
method.description: Set the [i]editable[/i] status of the [LineEdit]. When disabled, existing text can't be modified and new text can't be added.

method.name: is_editable
method.description: Return the [i]editable[/i] status of the [LineEdit] (see [method set_editable]).

method.name: set_secret
method.description: Set the [i]secret[/i] status of the [LineEdit]. When enabled, every character is displayed as "*".

method.name: is_secret
method.description: Return the [i]secret[/i] status of the [LineEdit] (see [method set_secret]).

signal.name: text_entered
signal.description: This signal is emitted when the user presses KEY_ENTER on the [LineEdit]. This signal is often used as an alternate confirmation mechanism in dialogs.

signal.name: text_changed
