signal.description: When the text changes, this signal is emitted.

class.name: LineShape2D
class.description: Line shape for 2D collision objects. It works like a 2D plane and will not allow any body to go to the negative side. Not recommended for rigid bodies, and usually not recommended for static bodies either because it forces checks against it on every frame.

method.name: set_normal
method.description: Set the line normal.

method.name: get_normal
method.description: Return the line normal.

method.name: set_d
method.description: Set the line distance from the origin.

method.name: get_d
method.description: Return the line distance from the origin.

class.name: MainLoop
class.brief_description: Main loop is the abstract main loop base class.
class.description: Main loop is the abstract main loop base class. All other main loop classes are derived from it. Upon application start, a [MainLoop] has to be provided to OS, else the application will exit. This happens automatically (and a [SceneMainLoop] is created), unless a main [Script] is supplied, which may or not create and return a [MainLoop].

class.name: MarginContainer
class.description: Simple margin container. Adds a left margin to anything contained.

class.name: Material
class.brief_description: Abstract base [Resource] for coloring and shading geometry.
class.description: Material is a base [Resource] used for coloring and shading geometry. All materials inherit from it and almost all [VisualInstance] derived nodes carry a Material. A few flags and parameters are shared between all material types and are configured here.

method.name: set_flag
method.description: Set a [Material] flag, which toggles on or off a behavior when rendering. See enumeration FLAG_* for a list.

method.name: get_flag
method.description: Return a [Material] flag, which toggles on or off a behavior when rendering. See enumeration FLAG_* for a list.

method.name: set_blend_mode
method.description: Set blend mode for the material, which can be one of BLEND_MODE_MIX (default), BLEND_MODE_ADD, BLEND_MODE_SUB. Keep in mind that only BLEND_MODE_MIX ensures that the material [i]may[/i] be opaque, any other blend mode will render with alpha blending enabled in raster-based [VisualServer] implementations.

method.name: get_blend_mode
method.description: Return blend mode for the material, which can be one of BLEND_MODE_MIX (default), BLEND_MODE_ADD, BLEND_MODE_SUB. Keep in mind that only BLEND_MODE_MIX ensures that the material [i]may[/i] be opaque, any other blend mode will render with alpha blending enabled in raster-based [VisualServer] implementations.

method.name: set_line_width
method.description: Set the line width for geometry drawn with FLAG_WIREFRAME enabled, or LINE primitives. Note that not all hardware or VisualServer backends support this (like DirectX).

method.name: get_line_width
method.description: Return the line width for geometry drawn with FLAG_WIREFRAME enabled, or LINE primitives. Note that not all hardware or VisualServer backends support this (like DirectX).

constants.constant: Geometry is visible when this flag is enabled (default).
Both front facing and back facing triangles are rendered when this flag is enabled.
Front facing and back facing order is swapped when this flag is enabled.
Shading (lighting) is disabled when this flag is enabled.
Maximum amount of flags.
Use the regular alpha blending equation (source and dest colors are faded) (default).
Use additive blending equation, often used for particle effects such as fire or light decals.
Use substractive blending equation, often used for some smoke effects or types of glass.

class.name: Matrix3
class.description: 3x3 matrix used for 3D rotation and scale. Contains 3 vector fields x,y and z. Can also be accessed as array of 3D vectors. Almost always used as orthogonal basis for a [Transform].

method.name: determinant
method.description: Return the determinant of the matrix.

method.name: get_euler
method.description: Return euler angles from the matrix.

method.name: inverse
method.description: Return the affine inverse of the matrix.

method.name: orthonormalized
method.description: Return the orthonormalized version of the matrix (useful to call from time to time to avoid rounding error).

method.name: rotated
method.description: Return the rotated version of the matrix, by a given axis and angle.

method.name: scaled
method.description: Return the scaled version of the matrix, by a 3D scale.

method.name: tdotx
method.description: Transposed dot product with the x axis of the matrix.

method.name: tdoty
method.description: Transposed dot product with the y axis of the matrix.

method.name: tdotz
method.description: Transposed dot product with the z axis of the matrix.

method.name: transposed
method.description: Return the transposed version of the matrix.

method.name: xform
method.description: Return a vector transformed by the matrix and return it.

method.name: xform_inv
method.description: Return a vector transformed by the transposed matrix and return it.

method.name: Matrix3
method.description: Create a matrix from 3 axis vectors.

method.name: Matrix3
method.description: Create a matrix from an axis vector and an angle.

method.name: Matrix3
method.description: Create a matrix from a quaternion.

class.name: Matrix32
class.description: 3x2 Matrix for 2D transforms.

class.name: MenuButton
class.brief_description: Special button that brings up a [PopupMenu] when clicked.
class.description: Special button that brings up a [PopupMenu] when clicked. That's pretty much all it does, as it's just a helper class when bulding GUIs.

method.name: get_popup
method.description: Return the [PopupMenu] contained in this button.

class.name: Mesh
class.brief_description: A [Resource] that contains vertex-array based geometry.
class.description: Mesh is a type of [Resource] that contains vertex-array based geometry, divided in [i]surfaces[/i]. Each surface contains a completely separate array and a material used to draw it. Design wise, a mesh with multiple surfaces is prefered to a single surface, because objects created in 3D editing software commonly contain multiple materials.

method.name: add_surface
method.description: Create a new surface ([method get_surface_count] that will become surf_idx for this. Surfaces are created to be rendered using a "primitive", which may be PRIMITIVE_POINTS, PRIMITIVE_LINES, PRIMITIVE_LINE_STRIP, PRIMITIVE_LINE_LOOP, PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES, PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLE_STRIP, PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLE_FAN. (As a note, when using indices, it is recommended to only use just points, lines or triangles). The format of a surface determines which arrays it will allocate and hold, so "format" is a combination of ARRAY_FORMAT_* mask constants ORed together. ARRAY_FORMAT_VERTEX must be always present. "array_len" determines the amount of vertices in the array (not primitives!). if ARRAY_FORMAT_INDEX is in the format mask, then it means that an index array will be allocated and "index_array_len" must be passed.

method.name: get_surface_count
method.description: Return the amount of surfaces that the [Mesh] holds.

method.name: surface_remove
method.description: Remove a surface at position surf_idx, shifting greater surfaces one surf_idx slot down.

method.name: surface_get_array_len
method.description: Return the length in vertices of the vertex array in the requested surface (see [method add_surface]).

method.name: surface_get_array_index_len
method.description: Return the length in indices of the index array in the requested surface (see [method add_surface]).

method.name: surface_get_format
method.description: Return the format mask of the requested surface (see [method add_surface]).

method.name: surface_get_primitive_type
method.description: Return the primitive type of the requested surface (see [method add_surface]).

method.name: surface_set_material
method.description: Set a [Material] for a given surface. Surface will be rendered using this material.

method.name: surface_get_material
method.description: Return a [Material] in a given surface. Surface is rendered using this material.

constants.constant: Default value used for index_array_len when no indices are present.
Amount of weights/bone indices per vertex (always 4).
Vertex array (array of [Vector3]() vertices).
Normal array (array of [Vector3]() normals).
Tangent array, array of groups of 4 floats. first 3 floats determine the tangent, and the last the binormal direction as -1 or 1.
Vertex array (array of [Color]() colors).
UV array (array of [Vector3]() UVs or float array of groups of 2 floats (u,v)).
Second UV array (array of [Vector3]() UVs or float array of groups of 2 floats (u,v)).
Array of bone indices, as a float array. Each element in groups of 4 floats.
Array of bone weights, as a float array. Each element in groups of 4 floats.
Array of integers, used as indices referencing vertices. No index can be beyond the vertex array size.
Array format will include vertices (mandatory).
Array format will include normals
Array format will include tangents
Array format will include a color array.
Array format will include UVs.
Array format will include another set of UVs.
Array format will include bone indices.
Array format will include bone weights.
Index array will be used.
Render array as points (one vertex equals one point).
Render array as lines (every two vertices a line is created).
Render array as line strip.
Render array as line loop (like line strip, but closed).
Render array as triangles (every three vertices a triangle is created).
Render array as triangle strips.
Render array as triangle fans.

class.name: MeshInstance
class.brief_description: Node that instances meshes into a [Scenario].
class.description: MeshInstance is a [Node] that takes a [Mesh] resource and adds it to the current [Scenario] by creating an instance of it. This is the class most often used to get 3D geometry rendered and can be used to instance a sigle [Mesh] in many places. This allows to reuse geometry and save on resources. When a [Mesh] has to be instanced more than thousands of times at close proximity, consider using a [MultiMesh] in a [MultiMeshInstance] instead.

method.name: set_mesh
method.description: Set the [Mesh] resource for the instance.

method.name: get_mesh
method.description: Return the current [Mesh] resource for the instance.

method.name: get_aabb
method.description: Return the AABB of the mesh, in local coordinates.

method.name: create_trimesh_collision
method.description: This helper creates a [StaticBody] child [Node] using the mesh geometry as collision. It's mainly used for testing.

class.name: MeshLibrary
class.description: Library of meshes. Contains a list of [Mesh] resources, each with name and ID. Useful for GridMap or painting Terrain.

method.name: create_item
method.description: Create a new item in the library, supplied an id.

method.name: set_item_name
method.description: Set the name of the item.

method.name: set_item_mesh
method.description: Set the mesh of the item.

method.name: get_item_name
method.description: Return the name of the item.

method.name: get_item_mesh
method.description: Return the mesh of the item.

method.name: remove_item
method.description: Remove the item.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the library.

method.name: get_item_list
method.description: Return the list of items.

method.name: get_last_unused_item_id
method.description: Get an unused id for a new item.

class.name: MultiMesh
class.description: MultiMesh provides low level mesh instancing. If the amount of [Mesh] instances needed goes from hundreds to thousands (and most need to be visible at close proximity) creating such a large amount of [MeshInstance] nodes may affect performance by using too much CPU or video memory. For this case a MultiMesh becomes very useful, as it can draw thousands of instances with little API overhead.[br] As a drawback, if the instances are too far away of each other, performance may be reduced as every sigle instance will always rendered (they are spatially indexed as one, for the whole object). Since instances may have any behavior, the AABB used for visibility must be provided by the user, or generated with [method generate_aabb].

method.name: set_mesh
method.description: Set the [Mesh] resource to be drawn in multiple instances.

method.name: get_mesh
method.description: Return the [Mesh] resource drawn as multiple instances.

method.name: set_instance_count
method.description: Set the amount of instnces that is going to be drawn. Changing this number will erase all the existing instance transform and color data.

method.name: get_instance_count
method.description: Return the amount of instnces that is going to be drawn.

method.name: set_instance_transform
method.description: Set the transform for a specific instance.

method.name: get_instance_transform
method.description: Return the transform of a specific instance.

method.name: set_instance_color
method.description: Set the color of a specific instance.

method.name: get_instance_color
method.description: Get the color of a specific instance.

method.name: set_aabb
method.description: Set the visibility AABB. If not provided, MultiMesh will not be visible.

method.name: get_aabb
method.description: Return the visibility AABB.

method.name: generate_aabb
method.description: Generate a new visibility AABB, using mesh AABB and instance transforms. Since instance information is stored in the [VisualServer], this function is VERY SLOW and must NOT be used often.

class.name: MultiMeshInstance
class.description: MultiMeshInstance is a [Node] that takes a [MultiMesh] resource and adds it to the current [Scenario] by creating an instance of it (yes, this is an instance of instances).

method.name: set_multimesh
method.description: Set the [MultiMesh] to be instance.

method.name: get_multimesh
method.description: Return the [MultiMesh] that is used for instancing.

class.name: Node
class.brief_description: Base class for all the "Scene" elements.
class.description: Nodes can be set as children of other nodes, resulting in a tree arrangement. Any tree of nodes is called a "Scene". Scenes can be saved to disk, and then instanced into other scenes. This allows for very high flexibility in the architecture and data model of the projects. [SceneMainLoop] contains the "active" tree of nodes, and a node becomes active (receinving NOTIFICATION_ENTER_SCENE) when added to that tree. A node can contain any number of nodes as a children (but there is only one tree root) with the requirement that no two childrens with the same name can exist. Nodes can, optionally, be added to groups. This makes it easy to reach a number of nodes from the code (for example an "enemies" group). Nodes can be set to "process" state, so they constantly receive a callback requesting them to process (do anything). Normal processing ([method _process]) happens as fast as possible and is dependent on the frame rate, so the processing time delta is variable. Fixed processing ([method _fixed_process]) happens a fixed amount of times per second (by default 60) and is useful to link itself to the physics. Nodes can also process input events. When set, the [method _input] function will be called with every input that the program receives. Since this is usually too overkill (unless used for simple projects), an [method _unhandled_input] function is called when the input was not handled by anyone else (usually, GUI [Control] nodes). To keep track of the scene hieararchy (specially when instancing scenes into scenes) an "owner" can be set to a node. This keeps track of who instanced what. This is mostly useful when writing editors and tools, though. Finally, when a node is freed, it will free all its children nodes too.

method.name: _fixed_process
method.description: Called for fixed processing (synced to the physics).

method.name: _input
method.description: Called when any input happens (also must enable with [method set_process_input] or the property).

method.name: _process
method.description: Called for processing. This is called every frame, with the delta time from the previous frame.

method.name: _ready
method.description: Called when ready (entered scene and children entered too).

method.name: _unhandled_input
method.description: Called when any input happens that was not handled by something else (also must enable with [method set_process_unhandled_input] or the property).

method.name: _unhandled_key_input
method.description: Called when any key input happens that was not handled by something else.

method.name: set_name
method.description: Set the name of the [Node]. Name must be unique within parent, and setting an already existing name will cause for the node to be automatically renamed.

method.name: get_name
method.description: Return the name of the [Node]. Name is be unique within parent.

method.name: add_child
method.description: Add a child [Node]. Nodes can have as many children as they want, but every child must have a unique name. Children nodes are automatically deleted when the parent node is deleted, so deleting a whole scene is performed by deleting its topmost node.

method.name: remove_child
method.description: Remove a child [Node]. Node is NOT deleted and will have to be deleted manually.

method.name: get_child_count
method.description: Return the amount of children nodes.

method.name: get_child
method.description: Return a children node by it's index (see [method get_child_count]). This method is often used for iterating all children of a node.

method.name: get_node
method.description:
Fetch a node. NodePath must be valid (or else error will occur) and can be either the path to child node, a relative path (from the current node to another node), or an absolute path to a node. Note: fetching absolute paths only works when the node is inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_scene]). Examples. Assume your current node is Character and following tree:[br] root/ root/Character root/Character/Sword root/Character/Backpack/Dagger root/MyGame root/Swamp/Alligator root/Swamp/Mosquito root/Swamp/Goblin
Possible paths are: - get_node("Sword") - get_node("Backpack/Dagger") - get_node("../Swamp/Alligator") - get_node("/root/MyGame")

method.name: get_parent
method.description: Return the parent [Node] of the current [Node], or an empty Object if the node lacks a parent.

method.name: is_a_parent_of
method.description: Return [i]true[/i] if the "node" argument is a direct or indirect child of the current node, otherwise return [i]false[/i].

method.name: is_greater_than
method.description: Return [i]true[/i] if "node" occurs later in the scene hierarchy than the current node, otherwise return [i]false[/i].

method.name: get_path
method.description: Return the absolute path of the current node. This only works if the curent node is inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_scene]).

method.name: get_path_to
method.description: Return the relative path from the current node to the specified node in "node" argument. Both nodes must be in the same scene, or else the function will fail.

method.name: add_to_group
method.description: Add a node to a group. Groups are helpers to name and organize group of nodes, like for example: "Enemies", "Collectables", etc. A [Node] can be in any number of groups. Nodes can be assigned a group at any time, but will not be added to it until they are inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_scene]).

method.name: remove_from_group
method.description: Remove a node from a group.

method.name: move_child
method.description: Move a child node to a different position (order) amongst the other children. Since calls, signals, etc are performed by tree order, changing the order of chilren nodes may be useful.

method.name: raise
method.description: Move this node to the top of the array of nodes of the parent node. This is often useful on GUIs ([Control]), because their order of drawing fully depends on their order in the tree.

method.name: set_owner
method.description: Set the node owner. A node can have any other node as owner (as long as a valid parent, grandparent, etc ascending in the tree). When saving a node (using SceneSaver) all the nodes it owns will be saved with it. This allows to create complex SceneTrees, with instancing and subinstancing.

method.name: get_owner
method.description: Get the node owner (see [method set_node_owner]).

method.name: remove_and_skip
method.description: Remove a node and set all its children as childrens of the parent node (if exists). All even subscriptions that pass by the removed node will be unsubscribed.

method.name: get_index
method.description: Get the node index in the parent (assuming it has a parent).

method.name: print_tree
method.description: Print the screne to stdout. Used mainly for debugging purposes.

method.name: set_filename
method.description: A node can contain a filename. This filename should not be changed by the user, unless writing editors and tools. When a scene is instanced from a file, it topmost node contains the filename from where it was loaded.

method.name: get_filename
method.description: Return a filename that may be containedA node can contained by the node. When a scene is instanced from a file, it topmost node contains the filename from where it was loaded (see [method set_filename]).

method.name: propagate_notification
method.description: Notify the current node and all its chldren recursively by calling notification() in all of them.

method.name: set_fixed_process
method.description: Enables or disables node fixed framerate processing. When a node is being processed, it will receive a NOTIFICATION_PROCESS at a fixed (usually 60fps, check [OS] to change that) interval (and the [method _fixed_process] callback will be called if exists). It is common to check how much time was elapsed since the previous frame by calling [method get_fixed_process_time].

method.name: get_fixed_process_delta_time
method.description: Return the time elapsed since the last fixed frame. This is always the same in fixed proecssing unless the frames per second is changed in [OS].

method.name: is_fixed_processing
method.description: Return true if fixed processing is enabled (see [method set_fixed_process]).

method.name: set_process
method.description: Enables or disables node processing. When a node is being processed, it will receive a NOTIFICATION_PROCESS on every drawn frame (and the [method _process] callback will be called if exists). It is common to check how much time was elapsed since the previous frame by calling [method get_process_time].

method.name: get_process_delta_time
method.description: Return the time elapsed (in seconds) since the last process callback. This is almost always different each time.

method.name: is_processing
method.description: Return whether processing is enabled in the current node (see [method set_process]).

method.name: set_process_input
method.description: Enable input processing for node. This is not requiered for GUI controls! It hooks up the node to receive all input (see [method _input]).

method.name: is_processing_input
method.description: Return true if the node is processing input (see [method set_process_input]).

method.name: set_process_unhandled_input
method.description: Enable unhandled input processing for node. This is not requiered for GUI controls! It hooks up the node to receive all input that was not previously handled before (usually by a [Control]). (see [method _unhandled_input]).

method.name: is_processing_unhandled_input
method.description: Return true if the node is processing unhandled input (see [method set_process_unhandled_input]).

method.name: can_process
method.description: Return true if the node can process.

method.name: duplicate
method.description: Return a duplicate of the scene, with all nodes and parameters copied. Subscriptions will not be duplicated.

method.name: replace_by
method.description: Replace a node in a scene by a given one. Subscriptions that pass through this node will be lost.

signal.name: renamed
signal.description: Emitted when the node is renamed.

constants.constant: Notification received every frame when the process flag is set (see [method set_process]).
Notification received when a node is set as a child of another node. Note that this doesn't mean that a node entered the Scene Tree.
Notification received when a node is unparented (parent removed it from the list of children).

class.name: Node2D
class.description: Base node for 2D system. Node2D contains a position, rotation and scale, which is used to position and animate. It can alternatively be used with a custom 2D transform ([Matrix32]). A tree of Node2Ds allows complex hierachies for animation and positioning.

method.name: set_pos
method.description: Set the position of the 2d node.

method.name: set_rot
method.description: Set the rotation of the 2d node.

method.name: set_scale
method.description: Set the scale of the 2d node.

method.name: get_pos
method.description: Return the position of the 2D node.

method.name: get_rot
method.description: Return the rotation of the 2D node.

method.name: get_scale
method.description: Return the scale of the 2D node.

method.name: get_global_pos
method.description: Return the global position of the 2D node.

class.name: NodePath
class.brief_description: Built-in type optimized for path traversing.
class.description: Built-in type optimized for path traversing. A Node path is an optimized compiled path used for traversing the scene tree. It references nodes and can reference properties in that node, or even reference properties inside the resources of the node.

method.name: get_name
method.description: Return a path level name.

method.name: get_name_count
method.description: Return the path level count.

method.name: get_property
method.description: Return the property associated (empty if none).

method.name: get_subname
method.description: Return the subname level name.

method.name: get_subname_count
method.description: Return the subname count.

method.name: is_absolute
method.description: Return true if the node path is absolute (not relative).

method.name: is_empty
method.description: Return true if the node path is empty.

class.name: OS
class.description: Operating System functions. OS Wraps the most common functionality to communicate with the host Operating System, such as: -Mouse Grabbing -Mouse Cursors -Clipboard -Video Mode -Date " Time -Timers -Environment Variables -Execution of Binaries -Command Line

method.name: set_clipboard
method.description: Set clipboard to the OS.

method.name: get_clipboard
method.description: Get clipboard from the host OS.

method.name: set_video_mode
method.description: Change the video mode.

method.name: get_video_mode_size
method.description: Return the current video mode size.

method.name: is_video_mode_fullscreen
method.description: Return true if the current video mode is fullscreen.

method.name: is_video_mode_resizable
method.description: Return true if the window is resizable.

method.name: get_fullscreen_mode_list
method.description: Return the list of fullscreen modes.

method.name: set_iterations_per_second
method.description: Set the amount of fixed iterations per second (for fixed process and physics).

method.name: get_iterations_per_second
method.description: Return the amount of fixed iterations per second (for fixed process and physics).

method.name: set_low_processor_usage_mode
method.description: Set to true to enable the low cpu usage mode. In this mode, the screen only redraws when there are changes, and a considerable sleep time is inserted between frames. This way, editors using the engine UI only use very little cpu.

method.name: is_in_low_processor_usage_mode
method.description: Return true if low cpu usage mode is enabled.

method.name: get_executable_path
method.description: Return the path to the current engine executable.

method.name: execute
method.description: Execute the binary file in given path, optionally blocking until it returns. A process ID is returned.

method.name: kill
method.description: Kill a process ID.

method.name: get_environment
method.description: Return an environment variable.

method.name: has_environment
method.description: Return true if an envieronment variable exists.

method.name: get_name
method.description: Return the name of the host OS.

method.name: get_cmdline_args
method.description: Return the commandline passed to the engine.

method.name: get_main_loop
method.description: Return the main loop object (see [MainLoop]).

method.name: get_date
method.description: Return the current date.

method.name: get_time
method.description: Return the current time.

method.name: delay_usec
method.description: Delay executing of the current thread by given microseconds.

method.name: delay_msec
method.description: Delay executing of the current thread by given milliseconds.

method.name: get_ticks_msec
method.description: Return the amount of time passed in milliseconds since the engine started.

method.name: get_locale
method.description: Return the host OS locale.

method.name: can_draw
method.description: Return true if the host OS allows drawing.

method.name: get_frames_drawn
method.description: Return the total amount of frames drawn.

method.name: is_stdout_verbose
method.description: Return true if the engine was executed with -v (verbose stdout).

method.name: get_static_memory_peak_usage
method.description: Return the max amount of static memory used (only works in debug).

method.name: get_dynamic_memory_usage
method.description: Return the total amount of dynamic memory used (only works in debug).

class.name: Object
class.brief_description: Base class for all non built-in types.
class.description: Base class for all non built-in types. Everything not a built-in type starts the inheritance chain from this class. Objects do not manage memory, if inheriting from one the object will most likely have to be deleted manually (call the [method free] function from the script or delete from C++). Some derivates add memory management, such as [Reference] (which keps a reference count and deletes itself automatically when no longer referenced) and [Node], which deletes the children tree when deleted. Objects export properties, which are mainly useful for storage and editing, but not really so much in programming. Properties are exported in [method _get_property_list] and handled in [method _get] and [_set]. However, scripting languages and C++ have simper means to export them. Objects also receive notifications ([method _notification]). Notifications are a simple way to notify the object about simple events, so they can all be handled together.

method.name: _get
method.description: Return a property, return null if the property does not exist.

method.name: _get_property_list
method.description: Return the property list, array of dictionaries, dictionaries must countain: name:String, type:int (see TYPE_* enum in globals) and optionally: hint:int (see PROPERTY_HINT_* in globals), hint_string:String, usage:int (see PROPERTY_USAGE_* in globals).

method.name: _notification
method.description: Notification request, the notification id is received.

method.name: _set
method.description: Set a property. Return true if the property was found.

method.name: get_type
method.description: Return the type of the object as a string.

method.name: is_type
method.description: Check the type of the obeject against a string (including inheritance).

method.name: set
method.description: Set property into the object.

method.name: get
method.description: Get a property from the object.

method.name: get_property_list
method.description: Return the list of properties as an array of dictionaries, dictionaries countain: name:String, type:int (see TYPE_* enum in globals) and optionally: hint:int (see PROPERTY_HINT_* in globals), hint_string:String, usage:int (see PROPERTY_USAGE_* in globals).

method.name: notification
method.description: Notify the object of something.

method.name: get_instance_ID
method.description: Return the instance ID. All objects have a unique instance ID.

method.name: set_script
method.description: Set a script into the object, scripts extend the object functionality.

method.name: get_script
method.description: Return the object script (or null if it doesn't have one).

method.name: set_meta
method.description: Set a metadata into the object. Medatada is serialized. Metadata can be [i]anything[/i].

method.name: get_meta
method.description: Return a metadata from the object.

method.name: has_meta
method.description: Return true if a metadata is found with the requested name.

method.name: get_meta_list
method.description: Return the list of metadatas in the object.

method.name: add_user_signal
method.description: Add a user signal (can be added anytime). Arguments are optional, but can be added as an array of dictionaries, each containing "name" and "type" (from [@GlobalScope] TYPE_*).

method.name: emit_signal
method.description: Emit a signal. Arguments are passed in an array.

method.name: call
method.description: Call a function in the object, result is returned.

method.name: call_deferred
method.description: Create and store a function in the object. The call will take place on idle time.

method.name: get_signal_list
method.description: Return the list of signals as an array of dictionaries.

method.name: connect
method.description: Connect a signal to a method at a target (member function). Binds are optional and are passed as extra arguments to the call. Flags specify optional deferred or one shot connections, see enum CONNECT_*. A signal can only be connected once to a method, and it will throw an error if already connected. If you want to avoid this, use [method is_connected] to check.

method.name: disconnect
method.description: Disconnect a signal from a method.

method.name: is_connected
method.description: Return true if a connection exists for a given signal and target/method.

method.name: set_block_signals
method.description: If set to true, signal emission is blocked.

method.name: is_blocking_signals
method.description: Return true if signal emission blocking is enabled.

method.name: set_message_translation
method.description: Set true if this object can translate strings (in calls to tr() ). Default is true.

method.name: can_translate_messages
method.description: Return true if this object can translate strings.

method.name: XL_MESSAGE
method.description: Deprecated, will go away.

method.name: tr
method.description: Translate a message. Only works in message translation is enabled (which is by default). See [method set_message_translation].

constants.constant: Called right when the object is initialized. Not available in script.
Called before the object is about to be deleted.
Connect a signal in deferred mode. This way, signal emissions are stored in a queue, then set on idle time.
Persisting connections are saved when the object is serialized to file.
One short connections disconnect themselves after emission.

class.name: OmniLight
class.brief_description: OmniDirectional Light, such as a lightbulb or a candle.
class.description: An OmniDirectional light is a type of [Light] node that emits lights in all directions. The light is attenuated through the distance and this attenuation can be configured by changing the energy, radius and attenuation parameters of [Light]. TODO: Image of an omnilight.

class.name: OptionButton
class.brief_description: Button control that provides selectable options when pressed.
class.description: OptionButton is a type button that provides a selectable list of items when pressed. The item selected becomes the "current" item and is displayed as the button text.

method.name: add_item
method.description: Add an item, with text "label" and (optionally) id. If no "id" is passed, "id" becomes the item index. New items are appended at the end.

method.name: add_icon_item
method.description: Add an item, with a "texture" icon, text "label" and (optionally) id. If no "id" is passed, "id" becomes the item index. New items are appended at the end.

method.name: set_item_text
method.description: Set the text of an item at index "idx".

method.name: set_item_icon
method.description: Set the icon of an item at index "idx".

method.name: set_item_ID
method.description: Set the ID of an item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_text
method.description: Return the text of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_icon
method.description: Return the icon of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_ID
method.description: Return the ID of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_count
method.description: Return the amount of items in the OptionButton.

method.name: add_separator
method.description: Add a separator to the list of items. Separators help to group items. Separator also takes up an index and is appended at the end.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear all the items in the [OptionButton].

method.name: select
method.description: Select an item by index and make it the current item.

method.name: get_selected
method.description: Return the current item index

signal.name: item_selected
signal.description: This signal is emitted when the current item was changed by the user. ID of the item selected is passed as argument (if no IDs were added, ID will be just the item index).

class.name: PHashTranslation
class.description: Optimized translation. Uses real-time compressed translations, which results in very small dictionaries.

class.name: PackedScene
class.description: TODO: explain ownership, and that node does not need to own itself

method.name: pack
method.description: Pack will ignore any sub-nodes not owned by given node. See [Node.set_owner].

class.name: PacketPeer
class.brief_description: Abstraction and base class for packet-based protocols.
class.description: PacketPeer is an abstration and base class for packet-based protocols (such as UDP). It provides an API for sending and receiving packets both as raw data or variables. This makes it easy to transfer data over a protocol, without having to encode data as low level bytes or having to worry about network ordering.

class.name: PacketPeerStream
class.brief_description: Wrapper to use a PacketPeer over a StreamPeer.
class.description: PacketStreamPeer provides a wrapper for working using packets over a stream. This allows for using packet based code with StreamPeers. PacketPeerStream implements a custom protocol over the StreamPeer, so the user should not read or write to the wrapped StreamPeer directly.

method.name: set_stream_peer
method.description: Set the StreamPeer object to be wrapped

class.name: Panel
class.brief_description: Provides an opaque background for [Control] children.
class.description: Panel is a [Control] that displays an opaque background. It's commoly used as a parent and container for other types of [Control] nodes. [center][img]images/panel_example.png[/img][/center]

class.name: PanelContainer
class.description: Panel container type. This container fits controls inside of the delimited area of a stylebox. It's useful for giving controls an outline.

class.name: Particles
class.description: Particles is a particle system 3D [Node] that is used to simulate several types of particle effects, such as explosions, rain, snow, fireflies, or other magical-like shinny sparkles. Particles are drawn using impostors, and given their dynamic behavior, the user must provide a visibility AABB (although helpers to create one automatically exist).

method.name: set_amount
method.description: Set total amount of particles in the system.

method.name: get_amount
method.description: Return the total amount of particles in the system.

method.name: set_emitting
method.description: Set the "emitting" property state. When emitting, the particle system generates new particles at constant rate.

method.name: is_emitting
method.description: Return the "emitting" property state (see [method set_emitting]).

method.name: set_visibility_aabb
method.description: Set the visibility AABB for the particle system, since the default one will not work properly most of the time.

method.name: get_visibility_aabb
method.description: Return the current visibility AABB.

method.name: set_emission_half_extents
method.description: Set the half extents for the emission box.

method.name: get_emission_half_extents
method.description: Return the half extents for the emission box.

method.name: set_gravity_normal
method.description: Set the normal vector towards where gravity is pulling (by default, negative Y).

method.name: get_gravity_normal
method.description: Return the normal vector towards where gravity is pulling (by default, negative Y).

method.name: set_variable
method.description: Set a specific variable for the particle system (see VAR_* enum).

method.name: get_variable
method.description: Return a specific variable for the particle system (see VAR_* enum).

method.name: set_randomness
method.description: Set the randomness for a specific variable of the particle system. Randomness produces small changes from the default each time a particle is emitted.

method.name: get_randomness
method.description: Return the randomness for a specific variable of the particle system. Randomness produces small changes from the default each time a particle is emitted.

method.name: set_color_phase_pos
method.description: Set the position of a color phase (0 to 1).

method.name: get_color_phase_pos
method.description: Return the position of a color phase (0 to 1).

method.name: set_color_phase_color
method.description: Set the color of a color phase.

method.name: get_color_phase_color
method.description: Return the color of a color phase.

method.name: set_material
method.description: Set the material used to draw particles.

method.name: get_material
method.description: Return the material used to draw particles.

class.name: PathRemap
class.brief_description: Singleton containing the list of remapped resources.
class.description: When exporting, the types of some resources may change internally so they are converted to more optimized versions. While it's not usually necesary to access to this directly (path remapping happens automatically when opeining a file), it's exported just for information.

method.name: add_remap
method.description: Add a remap from a file to another.

method.name: has_remap
method.description: Return true if a file is being remapped.

method.name: get_remap
method.description: Return the remapped new path of a file.

method.name: erase_remap
method.description: Erase a remap.

method.name: clear_remaps
method.description: Clear all remaps.

class.name: Physics2DDirectBodyState
class.brief_description: Direct access object to a physics body in the [Physics2DServer].
class.description: Direct access object to a physics body in the [Physics2DServer]. This object is passed via the direct state callback of rigid/character bodies, and is intended for changing the direct state of that body.

method.name: get_total_gravity
method.description: Return the total gravity vector being currently applied to this body.

method.name: get_total_density
method.description: Return the space density currently being applied to this body.

method.name: get_inverse_mass
method.description: Return the inverse of the mass of the body.

method.name: get_inverse_inertia
method.description: Return the inverse of the inertia of the body.

method.name: set_linear_velocity
method.description: Change the linear velocity of the body.

method.name: get_linear_velocity
method.description: Return the current linear velocity of the body.

method.name: set_angular_velocity
method.description: Change the angular velocity of the body.

method.name: get_angular_velocity
method.description: Return the angular velocity of the body.

method.name: set_transform
method.description: Change the transform matrix of the body.

method.name: get_transform
method.description: Return the transform matrix of the body.

method.name: set_sleep_state
method.description: Set the sleeping state of the body, only affects character/rigid bodies.

method.name: is_sleeping
method.description: Return true if this body is currently sleeping (not active).

method.name: get_contact_count
method.description: Return the amount of contacts this body has with other bodies. Note that by default this returns 0 unless bodies are configured to log contacts.

method.name: get_contact_local_pos
method.description: Return the local position (of this body) of the contact point.

method.name: get_contact_local_shape
method.description: Return the local shape index of the collision.

method.name: get_contact_collider
method.description: Return the RID of the collider.

method.name: get_contact_collider_pos
method.description: Return the contact position in the collider.

method.name: get_contact_collider_id
method.description: Return the object id of the collider.

method.name: get_contact_collider_object
method.description: Return the collider object, this depends on how it was created (will return a scene node if such was used to create it).

method.name: get_contact_collider_shape
method.description: Return the collider shape index.

method.name: get_contact_collider_velocity_at_pos
method.description: Return the linear velocity vector at contact point of the collider.

method.name: get_step
method.description: Return the timestep (delta) used for the simulation.

method.name: integrate_forces
method.description: Call the built-in force integration code.

method.name: get_space_state
method.description: Return the current state of space, useful for queries.

class.name: Physics2DDirectSpaceState
class.brief_description: Direct access object to a space in the [Physics2DServer].
class.description: Direct access object to a space in the [Physics2DServer]. It's used mainly to do queries against objects and areas residing in a given space.

method.name: intersect_ray
method.description: Intersect a ray in a given space, the returned object is a dictionary with the following fields: position: place where ray is stopped. normal: normal of the object at the point where the ray was stopped. shape: shape index of the object agaisnt which the ray was stopped. collider_: collider agaisnt which the ray was stopped. collider_id: collider id of the object agaisnt which the ray was stopped. collider: collider object agaisnt which the ray was stopped. rid: [RID] of the object agaisnt which the ray was stopped. If the ray did not intersect anything, then an empty dictionary (dir.empty()==true) is returned instead.

method.name: intersect_shape
method.description: Intersect a given shape (RID or [Shape2D]) against the space, the intersected shapes are returned in a special result object.

class.name: Physics2DServer
class.description: Physics 2D Server is the server responsible for all 2D physics.

class.name: PhysicsBody
class.brief_description: Base class for differnt types of Physics bodies.
class.description: PhysicsBody is an abstract base class for implementing a physics body. All PhysicsBody types inherit from it.

class.name: PhysicsShapeQueryResult
class.brief_description: Result of a shape query in Physics2DServer.

class.name: PinJoint2D
class.description: Pin Joint for 2D Rigid Bodies. It pins 2 bodies (rigid or static) together, or a single body to a fixed position in space.

class.name: Plane
class.description: Plane represents a normalized plane equation. Basically, "normal" is the normal of the plane (a,b,c normalized), and "d" is the distance from the origin to the plane (in the direction of "normal"). "Over" or "Above" the plane is considered the side of the plane towards where the normal is pointing.

method.name: center
method.description: Returns the center of the plane.

method.name: distance_to
method.description: Returns the shortest distance from the plane to the position "point".

method.name: get_any_point
method.description: Returns a point on the plane.

method.name: has_point
method.description: Returns true if "point" is inside the plane (by a very minimum treshold).

method.name: intersect_3
method.description: Returns the intersection point of the three planes "b", "c" and this plane. If no intersection is found null is returned.

method.name: intersects_ray
method.description: Returns the intersection point of a ray consisting of the position "from" and the direction normal "dir" with this plane. If no intersection is found null is returned.

method.name: intersects_segment
method.description: Returns the intersection point of a segment from position "begin" to position "end" with this plane. If no intersection is found null is returned.

method.name: is_point_over
method.description: Returns true if "point" is located above the plane.

method.name: normalized
method.description: Returns a copy of the plane, normalized.

method.name: project
method.description: Returns the orthogonal projection of point "p" into a point in the plane.

method.name: Plane
method.description: Creates a plane from the three parameters "a", "b", "c" and "d".

method.name: Plane
method.description: Creates a plane from three points.

method.name: Plane
method.description: Creates a plane from the normal and the plane's distance to the origin.

class.name: Popup
class.brief_description: Base container control for popups and dialogs.
class.description: PopUp is a base [Control] used to show dialogs and popups. It's a subwindow and modal by default (see [Control]) and has helpers for custom popup behavior.

method.name: popup_centered
method.description: Popup (show the control in modal form) in the center of the screen, at the curent size, or at a size determined by "size".

method.name: popup_centered_ratio
method.description: Popup (show the control in modal form) in the center of the screen, scalled at a ratio of size of the screen.

method.name: popup
method.description: Popup (show the control in modal form).

signal.name: about_to_show
signal.description: This signal is emitted when a popup is about to be shown. (often used in [PopupMenu] for clearing the list of options and creating a new one according to the current context).

class.name: PopupMenu
class.brief_description: PopupMenu displays a list of options.
class.description: PopupMenu is the typical Control that displays a list of options. They are popular in toolbars or context menus.

method.name: add_icon_item
method.description: Add a new item with text "label" and icon "texture". An id can optonally be provided, as well as an accelerator. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index.

method.name: add_item
method.description: Add a new item with text "label". An id can optonally be provided, as well as an accelerator. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index.

method.name: add_icon_check_item
method.description: Add a new checkable item with text "label" and icon "texture". An id can optonally be provided, as well as an accelerator. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index. Note that checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

method.name: add_check_item
method.description: Add a new checkable item with text "label". An id can optonally be provided, as well as an accelerator. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index. Note that checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

method.name: set_item_text
method.description: Set the text of the item at index "idx".

method.name: set_item_icon
method.description: Set the icon of the item at index "idx".

method.name: set_item_accelerator
method.description: Set the accelerator of the item at index "idx". Accelerators are special combinations of keys that activate the item, no matter which control is focused.

method.name: set_item_checked
method.description: Set the checkstate status of the item at index "idx".

method.name: set_item_ID
method.description: Set the id of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_text
method.description: Return the text of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_icon
method.description: Return the icon of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_accelerator
method.description: Return the accelerator of the item at index "idx". Accelerators are special combinations of keys that activate the item, no matter which control is focused.

method.name: is_item_checked
method.description: Return the checkstate status of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_ID
method.description: Return the id of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_index
method.description: Find and return the index of the item containing a given id.

method.name: get_item_count
method.description: Return the amount of items.

method.name: add_separator
method.description: Add a separator between items. Separators also occupy an index.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the popup menu.

signal.name: item_pressed
signal.description: This even is emitted when an item is pressed or its accelerator is activated. The id of the item is returned if it exists, else the index.

class.name: Portal
class.brief_description: Portals provide virtual openings to rooms.
class.description: Portals provide virtual openings to [RoomInstance] nodes, so cameras can look at them from the outside. Note that portals are a visibility optimization technique, and are in no way related to the game of the same name (as in, they are not used for teleportation). For more information on how rooms and portals work, see [RoomInstance]. Portals are represented as 2D convex polygon shapes (in the X,Y local plane), and are placed on the surface of the areas occupied by a [RoomInstance], to indicate that the room can be accessed or looked-at through them. If two rooms are next to each other, and two similar portals in each of them share the same world position (and are parallel and opposed to each other), they will automatically "connect" and form "doors" (for example, the portals that connect a kitchen to a living room are placed in the door they share). Portals must always have a [RoomInstance] node as a parent, grandparent or far parent, or else they will not be active.

method.name: set_shape
method.description: Set the portal shape. The shape is an array of [Point2] points, representing a convex polygon in the X,Y plane.

method.name: get_shape
method.description: Return the portal shape. The shape is an array of [Point2] points, representing a convex polygon in the X,Y plane.

method.name: set_enabled
method.description: Enable the portal (it is enabled by defaul though), disabling it will cause the parent [RoomInstance] to not be visible any longer when looking through the portal.

method.name: is_enabled
method.description: Return wether the portal is active. When disabled it causes the parent [RoomInstance] to not be visible any longer when looking through the portal.

method.name: set_disable_distance
method.description: Set the distance threshold for disabling the portal. Every time that the portal goes beyond "distance", it disables itself, becoming the opaque color (see [method set_disabled_color]).

method.name: get_disable_distance
method.description: Return the distance threshold for disabling the portal. Every time that the portal goes beyond "distance", it disables itself, becoming the opaque color (see [method set_disabled_color]).

method.name: set_disabled_color
method.description: When the portal goes beyond the disable distance (see [method set_disable_distance]), it becomes opaque and displayed with color "color".

method.name: get_disabled_color
method.description: Return the color for when the portal goes beyond the disable distance (see [method set_disable_distance]) and becomes disabled.

method.name: set_connect_range
method.description: Set the range for auto-connecting two portals from different rooms sharing the same space.

method.name: get_connect_range
method.description: Return the range for auto-connecting two portals from different rooms sharing the same space.

class.name: Position2D
class.description: Generic 2D Position hint for editing. It's just like a plain [Node2D] but displays as a cross in the 2D-Editor at all times.

class.name: Position3D
class.description: Generic 3D Position hint for editing. It's just like a plain [Spatial] but displays as a cross in the 3D-Editor at all times.

class.name: ProgressBar
class.description: General purpose progress bar. Shows fill percentage from right to left.

class.name: ProximityGroup
class.description: General purpose proximity-detection node.

class.name: Quat
class.description: Quaternion is a 4 dimensional vector that is used to represent a rotation. It mainly exists to perform SLERP (spherical-linear interpolation) between to rotations obtained by a Matrix3 cheaply. Adding quaternions also cheaply adds the rotations, however quaternions need to be often normalized, or else they suffer from precision issues.

method.name: dot
method.description: Returns the dot product between two quaternions.

method.name: inverse
method.description: Returns the inverse of the quaternion (applies to the inverse rotatio too).

method.name: length
method.description: Returns the length of the quaternion.

method.name: length_squared
method.description: Returns the length of the quaternion, squared.

method.name: normalized
method.description: Returns a copy of the quaternion, normalized to unit length.

method.name: slerp
method.description: Perform a spherical-linear interpolation with another quaternion.

class.name: Range
class.brief_description: Abstract base class for range-based controls.
class.description: Range is a base class for [Control] nodes that change a floating point [i]value[/i] between a [i]minimum[/i] and a [i]maximum[/i], using [i]step[/i] and [i]page[/i], for example a [ScrollBar].

method.name: get_val
method.description: Return the current value.

method.name: get_min
method.description: Return the minimum value.

method.name: get_max
method.description: Return the maximum value.

method.name: get_step
method.description: Return the stepping, if step is 0, stepping is disabled.

method.name: get_page
method.description: Return the page size, if page is 0, paging is disabled.

method.name: get_unit_value
method.description: Return value mapped to 0 to 1 (unit) range.

method.name: set_min
method.description: Set minimum value, clamped range value to it if it's less.

method.name: set_step
method.description: Set step value. If step is 0, stepping will be disabled.

method.name: set_page
method.description: Set page size. Page is mainly used for scrollbars or anything that controls text scrolling.

method.name: set_unit_value
method.description: Set value mapped to 0 to 1 (unit) range, it will then be converted to the actual value within min and max.

signal.name: value_changed
signal.description: This signal is emitted when value changes.

signal.name: changed
signal.description: This signal is emitted when min, max, range or step change.

class.name: RawArray
class.description: Raw byte array. Contains bytes. Optimized for memory usage, can't fragment the memory.

method.name: is_colliding
method.description: Return whether the closest object the ray is pointing to is colliding with the vector, with the vector length considered.

method.name: get_collider
method.description: Return the closest object the ray is pointing to. Note that this does not consider the length of the vector, so you must also use [is_colliding] to check if the object returned is actually colliding with the ray.

class.name: RayShape2D
class.description: Ray 2D shape resource for physics. A ray is not really a collision body, isntead it tries to separate itself from whatever is touching its far endpoint. It's often useful for ccharacters.

class.name: RealArray
class.description: Real Array. Array of floating point values. Can only contain floats. Optimized for memory usage, can't fragment the memory.

class.name: RectangleShape2D
class.description: Rectangle Shape for 2D Physics. This shape is useful for modelling box-like 2D objects.

method.name: set_extents
method.description: Set the half extents, the actual width and height of this shape is twice the half extents.

method.name: get_extents
method.description: Return the half extents, the actual width and height of this shape is twice the half extents.

class.name: Reference
class.brief_description: Base class for anything that keeps a reference count.
class.description: Base class for anything that keeps a reference count. Resource and many other helper objects inherit this. References keep an internal reference counter so they are only released when no longer in use.

method.name: reference
method.description: Increase the internal reference counter. Use this only if you really know what you are doing.

method.name: unreference
method.description: Decrease the internal reference counter. Use this only if you really know what you are doing.

class.name: ReferenceFrame
class.description: Reference frame for GUI. It's just like an empty control, except a red box is displayed while editing around it's size at all times.

class.name: Resource
class.description: Resource is the base class for all resource types. Resources are primarily data containers. They are reference counted and freed when no longer in use. They are also loaded only once from disk, and further attempts to load the resource will return the same reference (all this in contrast to a [Node], which is not reference counted and can be instanced from disk as many times as desred). Resources can be saved externally on disk or bundled into another object, such as a [Node] or another resource.

method.name: set_path
method.description: Set the path of the resource. This is useful mainly for editors when saving/loading, and shouldn't be changed by anything else.

method.name: get_path
method.description: Return the path of the resource. This is useful mainly for editors when saving/loading, and shouldn't be changed by anything else.

method.name: set_name
method.description: Set the name of the resources, any name is valid (it doesn't have to be unique). Name is for descriptive purposes only.

method.name: get_name
method.description: Return the name of the resources, any name is valid (it doesn't have to be unique). Name is for descriptive purposes only.

method.name: get_rid
method.description: Return the RID of the resource (or an empty RID). Many resources (such as [Texture], [Mesh], etc) are high level abstractions of resources stored in a server, so this function will return the original RID.

class.name: ResourceInteractiveLoader
class.description: Interactive Resource Loader. This object is returned by ResourceLoader when performing an interactive load. It allows to load with high granularity, so this is mainly useful for displaying load bars/percentages.

method.name: get_resource
method.description: Return the loaded resource (only if loaded). Otherwise, returns null.

method.name: poll
method.description: Poll the load. If OK is returned, this means poll will have to be called again. If ERR_EOF is returned, them the load has finished and the resource can be obtained by calling [get_resource].

method.name: get_stage
method.description: Return the load stage. The total amount of stages can be queried with [get_stage_count]

method.name: get_stage_count
method.description: Return the total amount of stages (calls to [poll] ) needed to completely load this resource.

class.name: ResourceLoader
class.description: Resource Loader. This is a static object accessible as [ResourceLoader]. GDScript has a simplified load() function, though.

method.name: load_interactive
method.description: Load a resource interactively, the returned object allows to load with high granularity.

method.name: load
method.description: Load a resource. Optionally a hint can be given for the resource type to load.

method.name: get_recognized_extensions_for_type
method.description: Return the list of recognized extensions for a resource type.

method.name: set_abort_on_missing_resources
method.description: Change the behavior on missing sub-resources. Default is to abort load.

class.name: ResourcePreloader
class.description: Resource Preloader Node. This node is used to preload sub-resources inside a scene, so when the scene is loaded all the resourcs are ready to use and be retrieved from here.

method.name: add_resource
method.description: Add a resource to the preloader. Set the text-id that will be used to identify it (retrieve it/erase it/etc).

method.name: remove_resource
method.description: Remove a resource from the preloader by text id.

method.name: rename_resource
method.description: Rename a resource inside the preloader, from a text-id to a new text-id.

method.name: has_resource
method.description: Return true if the preloader has a given resource.

method.name: get_resource
method.description: Return the resource given a text-id.

method.name: get_resource_list
method.description: Return the list of resources inside the preloader.

class.name: ResourceSaver
class.description: Resource Saving Interface. This interface is used for saving resources to disk.

method.name: save
method.description: Save a resource to disk, to a given path.

method.name: get_recognized_extensions
method.description: Return the list of extensions available for saving a resource of a given type.

class.name: RichTextLabel
class.description: Label that displays rich text. Rich text can contain custom text, fonts, images and some basic formatting. It also adapts itself to given width/heights.

method.name: set_selection_enabled
method.description: Set to true if selecting the text inside this richtext is allowed.

method.name: is_selection_enabled
method.description: Return true if selecting the text inside this richtext is allowed.

class.name: RigidBody2D
class.description: Rigid body 2D node. This node is used for placing rigid bodies in the scene. It can contain a number of shapes, and also shift state between regular Rigid Body to Character or even Static. Character mode forbids the node from being rotated. This node can have a custom force integrator function, for writing complex physics motion behavior per node. As a warning, don't change this node position every frame or very often. Sporadic changes work fine, but physics runs at a different granularity (fixed hz) than usual rendering (process callback) and maybe even in a separate thread, so changing this from a process loop will yield strange behavior.

method.name: _integrate_forces
method.description: Override this function to use a custom force integrator. This allows to hook up to the physics processing and alter the simulation state for the object on every frame.

method.name: set_mode
method.description: Set the body mode, from the MODE_* enum. This allows to change to a static body or a character body.

method.name: get_mode
method.description: Return the current body mode, see [set_mode].

method.name: set_mass
method.description: Set the body mass.

method.name: get_mass
method.description: Return the body mass.

method.name: set_weight
method.description: Set the body mass given standard earth-weight (gravity 9.8). Not really useful for 2D since most measures for this node are in pixels.

method.name: get_weight
method.description: Return the body mass given standard earth-weight (gravity 9.8).

method.name: set_friction
method.description: Set the body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (full friction).

method.name: get_friction
method.description: Return the body friction.

method.name: set_bounce
method.description: Set the body bounciness, from 0 (no bounce) to 1 (bounce).

method.name: get_bounce
method.description: Return the body bounciness.

method.name: set_linear_velocity
method.description: Set the body linear velocity. Can be used sporadically, but[b] DONT SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME [/b], because physics may be running in another thread and definitely runs at a different granularity. Use [_integrate_forces] as your process loop if you want to have precise control of the body state.

method.name: get_linear_velocity
method.description: Return the body linear velocity. This changes by physics granularity. See [set_linear_velocity].

method.name: set_angular_velocity
method.description: Set the body angular velocity. Can be used sporadically, but[b] DONT SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME [/b], because physics may be running in another thread and definitely runs at a different granularity. Use [_integrate_forces] as your process loop if you want to have precise control of the body state.

method.name: get_angular_velocity
method.description: Return the body angular velocity. This changes by physics granularity. See [set_angular_velocity].

method.name: set_max_contacts_reported
method.description: Set the maximum contacts to report. Bodies can keep a log of the contacts with other bodies, this is enabled by setting the maximum amount of contacts reported to a number greater than 0.

method.name: get_max_contacts_reported
method.description: Return the maximum contacts that can be reported. See [set_max_contacts_reported].

method.name: set_use_custom_integrator
method.description: Set to true if the body shall not do any internal force integration at all (like gravity or air friction). Only the [_integrate_forces] will be able to integrate them if overrided.

method.name: is_using_custom_integrator
method.description: Return true if the body is not doing any built-in force integration.

method.name: set_contact_monitor
method.description: Enable contact monitoring. (the signals to notify when a body entered/exited collision).

method.name: is_contact_monitor_enabled
method.description: Return whether contact monitoring is enabled.

method.name: set_axis_velocity
method.description: Set an axis velocity. The velocity in the given vector axis will be set as the given vector length. (This is useful for jumping behavior).

method.name: apply_impulse
method.description: Apply a positioned impulse (which will be affected by the body mass and shape).

method.name: set_can_sleep
method.description: Set the body ability to fall asleep when not moving. This saves an enormous amount of processor time when there are plenty of rigid bodies (non static) in a scene.

method.name: is_able_to_sleep
method.description: Return true if the body has the ability to fall asleep when not moving. See [set_can_sleep].

signal.name: body_enter
signal.description: Emitted when a new body enters into contact with this one. Contact monitor and contacts reported must be enabled for this to work.

signal.name: body_enter_shape
signal.description: Emitted when a new body sub-shape enters into contact with this one. Contact monitor and contacts reported must be enabled for this to work.

signal.name: body_exit
signal.description: Emitted when a body exits contact with this one. Contact monitor and contacts reported must be enabled for this to work.

signal.name: body_exit_shape
signal.description: Emitted when a body shape exits contact with this one. Contact monitor and contacts reported must be enabled for this to work.

constants.constant: Static mode (does not move, can't be moved).
Rigid body, can move and rotate.
Character body, can move but not rotate.

class.name: Room
class.description: Room contains the data to define the bounds of a scene (using a BSP Tree). It is instanced by a [RoomInstance] node to create rooms. See that class documentation for more information about rooms.

class.name: Sample
class.description: Sample provides an audio sample class, containing audio data, together with some information for playback, such as format, mix rate and loop. It is used by sound playback routines.

method.name: create
method.description: Create new data for the sample, with format "format" (see FORMAT_* enum), stereo hint, and length in frames (not samples or bytes!) "frame". Calling create overrides previous existing data if it exists. Stereo samples are interleaved pairs of left and right (in that order) points

method.name: get_format
method.description: Return the sample format (see FORMAT_* enum).

method.name: is_stereo
method.description: Return true if the sample was created stereo.

method.name: get_length
method.description: Return the sample length in frames.

method.name: set_data
method.description: Set sample data. Data must be little endian, no matter the host platform, and exactly as long to fit all frames. Example, if data is Stereo, 16 bits, 256 frames, it will be 1024 bytes long.

method.name: get_data
method.description: Return sample data. Data will be little endian, no matter the host platform, and exactly as long to fit all frames. Example, if data is Stereo, 16 bits, 256 frames, it will be 1024 bytes long.

method.name: set_mix_rate
method.description: Set the mix rate for the sample (expected playback frequency).

method.name: get_mix_rate
method.description: Return the mix rate for the sample (expected playback frequency).

method.name: set_loop_format
method.description: Set the loop format, see LOOP_* enum

method.name: get_loop_format
method.description: Return the loop format, see LOOP_* enum.

method.name: set_loop_begin
method.description: Set the loop begin position, it must be a valid frame and less than the loop end position.

method.name: get_loop_begin
method.description: Return the loop begin position.

method.name: set_loop_end
method.description: Set the loop end position, it must be a valid frame and greater than the loop begin position.

method.name: get_loop_end
method.description: Return the loop begin position.

constants.constant: 8-Bits signed little endian PCM audio.
16-Bits signed little endian PCM audio.
IMA-ADPCM Audio.
No loop enabled.
Forward looping (when playback reaches loop end, goes back to loop begin)
Ping-Pong looping (when playback reaches loop end, plays backward untilloop begin). Not available in all platforms.

class.name: SampleLibrary
class.brief_description: Library that contains a collection of Samples.
class.description: Library that contains a collection of Samples, each identified by an text id. This is used as a data containeer for the majority of the SamplePlayer classes and derivatives.

method.name: add_sample
method.description: Add a sample to the library, with a given text id.

method.name: get_sample
method.description: Return a sample from the library, from a given text-id. Return null if the sample is not found.

method.name: has_sample
method.description: Return true if the sample text id exists in the library.

method.name: remove_sample
method.description: Remove a sample given a specific text id.

class.name: SamplePlayer
class.description: SamplePlayer is a [Node] meant for simple sample playback. A library of samples is loaded and played back "as is", without positioning or anything.

method.name: set_voice_count
method.description: Set the amount of simultaneous voices that will be used for playback.

method.name: get_voice_count
method.description: Return the amount of simultaneous voices that will be used for playback.

method.name: play
method.description: Play back sample, given it's identifier "name". If "unique" is true, all othere previous samples will be stopped. The voice allocated for playback will be returned.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop a voice "voice". (see [method play]).

method.name: set_mix_rate
method.description: Change the mix rate of a voice "voice" to given "hz".

method.name: set_pitch_scale
method.description: Scale the pitch (mix rate) of a voice by a ratio value "ratio". A ratio of 1.0 means the voice is unscaled.

method.name: set_volume
method.description: Set the volume of a voice, 0db is maximum volume (every about -6db, volume is reduced in half). "db" does in fact go from zero to negative.

method.name: set_pan
method.description: Set the panning of a voice. Panning goes from -1 (left) to +1 (right). Optionally, if the hardware supports 3D sound, also set depth and height (also in range -1 to +1).

method.name: set_filter
method.description: Set and enable a filter of a voice, with type "type" (see FILTER_* enum), cutoff (0 to 22khz) frequency and resonance (0+).

method.name: set_chorus
method.description: Set the chorus send level of a voice (0 to 1). For setting chorus parameters, see [AudioServer].

method.name: set_reverb
method.description: Set the reverb send level and type of a voice (0 to 1). (see REVERB_* enum for type).

method.name: get_mix_rate
method.description: Return the current mix rate for a given voice.

method.name: get_pitch_scale
method.description: Return the current pitch scale for a given voice.

method.name: get_volume
method.description: Return the current volume (in db) for a given voice. 0db is maximum volume (every about -6db, volume is reduced in half). "db" does in fact go from zero to negative.

method.name: get_pan
method.description: Return the current panning for a given voice. Panning goes from -1 (left) to +1 (right).

method.name: get_pan_depth
method.description: Return the current pan depth for a given voice (not used unless the hardware supports 3D sound)

method.name: get_pan_height
method.description: Return the current pan height for a given voice (not used unless the hardware supports 3D sound)

method.name: get_filter_type
method.description: Return the current filter type in use (see FILTER_* enum) for a given voice.

method.name: get_filter_cutoff
method.description: Return the current filter cutoff for a given voice. Cutoff goes from 0 to 22khz.

method.name: get_filter_resonance
method.description: Return the current filter resonance for a given voice. Resonance goes from 0 up.

method.name: get_chorus
method.description: Return the current chorus send level for a given voice. (0 to 1).

method.name: get_reverb_room
method.description: Return the current reverb room type for a given voice (see REVERB_* enum).

method.name: get_reverb
method.description: Return the current reverb send level for a given voice. (0 to 1).

constants.constant: Filter is disabled for voice.
Lowpass filter is used for voice.
Bandpass filter is used for voice.
Highpass filter is used for voice.
Notch (band reject) filter is used for voice.

Band-limit filter is used for voice, in this case resonance is the highpass cutoff. A band-limit filter has a different frequency response than a notch filter, but otherwise both are band-rejecting filters.
Small reverb room (house room).
Medium reverb room (street)
Large reverb room (Theather)
Huge reverb room (cathedral, warehouse).

class.name: SamplePlayer2D
class.description: Sample player for Positional 2D Sound. Plays sound samples positionally, left and right depending on the distance/place on the screen.

method.name: set_sample_library
method.description: Set the sample library for the player.

method.name: get_sample_library
method.description: Return the sample library used for the player.

method.name: set_polyphony
method.description: Set the polyphony of the player (maximum amount of simultaneous voices).

method.name: get_polyphony
method.description: Return the polyphony of the player (maximum amount of simultaneous voices).

method.name: play
